hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.text: Pass in an entity and a number of half-hearts, and it enchants that entity's fists thus increasing their damage per hit. One Amel and five Amethyst Shards per half-heart. Limit is four times the norm or just four for me.

hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.title: Enchant Feet
hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.text: Enchants the given entity's feet to increase their movement speed. Costs 1x Amel and 5x Amethyst Shards. Limit is 3x the norm. The norm for me is about 1.

hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.title: Enchant Arms
hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.text: Enchants the given *player's* arms, increasing their attack speed. Costs 1x Amel and 16x Amethyst Shards. Limit is 4 PLUS the norm.

hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.title: Enhancement Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_patterns#lapiswork.text: Gives you the amount the given entity has been enhanced in the given area (specified by number). The patterns before were sorted so 0 gives max health, 1 gives attack damage and so on. Negligible media cost.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:c.title: Enchantment Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:c.text: GIVEN AN ENTITY AND AN ENCHANTMENT ID, GIVES THE LEVEL OF THE ENCHANTMENT ON THE ENTITY FOR NEGLIGIBLE COST. NO AMEL REQUIRED. DOES NOT REQUIRE AN ENLIGHTENED MIND.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.title: Grant FireyFists
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.text: ENCHANT AN ENTITY'S FISTS WITH FIRE, AND IT WILL HENCEFORTH LIGHT ANY ENTITIES IT HITS ON FIRE FOR THREE SECONDS. CONSUMES 10 CHARGED AMETHYST. HAS 1 LEVEL. ID = 0.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:l.title: Grant Lightningbending
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:l.text: ENCHANT AN ENTITY'S FISTS WITH LIGHTNING. CONSUMES 20 CHARGED AMETHYST PER LEVEL. 3 LEVELS, EACH IMPROVING THE USER'S ABILITY TO CHANNEL LIGHTNING. ID = 1.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.title: Envelop Feet in Amel
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.text: ENVELOP FEET WITH AMEL THAT SPROUTS OUT TO BREAK ANY FALL 10 BLOCKS (PER LEVEL) OR BELOW. NO DAMAGE REDUCTION. TWO LEVELS. 5 CHARGED AMETHYST AND 32 AMEL PER LEVEL. ID = 2.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:l.title: Grant Amel Air Sacs
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:l.text: GIVES ME MORE LUNG CAPACITY, SIMILAR TO THE RESPIRATION ENCHANTMENT BUT TWICE AS STRONG. TWO LEVELS. 1 CHARGED AMETHYST AND 10 AMEL PER LEVEL. ID = 3.

hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.title: Make Fire-born
hexcasting:lapisworks_great#lapisworks:f.text: WIELD THE ENERGY OF AN ENTIRE STACK OF AMEL AND TEN PIECES OF CHARGED AMETHYST TO MAKE ONE HELL-BORNE! (FIRE WILL NO LONGER HURT THEM) ID = 4.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:co.title: Conjure Solid Color
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:co.text: Pass in a vector within Ambit and a dye color, to conjure a fragile but solid, colored block. This costs two amethyst dust and the number states which dye I want to dye the colored block. More explanation on the next page.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:sp.title: Spherical Exaltation
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:sp.text: Evaluates (exactly like Thoth's Gambit) the given pattern list over a hollow sphere with the given radius (non-decimal, at least 1, at most 64) around the given position.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:cu.title: Cubic Exaltation
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:cu.text: Evaluates (exactly like Thoth's Gambit) the given pattern list over a (hollow if given True) cube-ish area from the given points A to B.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:vi.title: Visible Distillation
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:vi.text: Negligible cost. Answers the question, "is there nothing there or between this place and there?". Both vectors must be in my ambit. Requires a player to cast it.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:em.title: Empty Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:em.text: Answers the question, "is there only air there?" for negligible media cost. Vector must be in my ambit.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:eq.title: Block Equivalency D.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:eq.text: Returns whether the two blocks are equivalent/roughly equal (the same kind of block), so wheat seeds equals a full wheat crop. Both blocks must be within my ambit.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:eq.title: Block Equality Dist.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:eq.text: Returns whether the two blocks are **exactly** equal, so wheat seeds do NOT equal a full wheat crop. Blocks must be within my ambit.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:re.title: Secretary's Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:re.text: Specific hand version of Scribe's Reflection. Pushes the Iota stored in the Iota holder in the specified hand to the stack.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:re.title: Reviewer's Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:re.text: Specific hand version of Auditor's Reflection. Pushes whether the item in the specified hand can be read from or not.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:wr.title: Amanuensis' Gambit
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:wr.text: Specific hand version of Scribe's Gambit. Writes the given Iota to the Iota holder in the specified hand.

hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:wr.title: Sanctioner's Prfn.
hexcasting:lapisworks_misc#lapisworks:wr.text: Specific hand version of Assessor's Reflection. Pusher whether the item in the specified hand can be written to or not.

hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.title: Bluemap Reflection
hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.text: Pushes a list of Maps for your current dimension from Bluemap to the stack

hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.title: Dynmap Reflection
hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.text: Pushes a list of Maps for your current dimension from Dynmap to the stack

hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.title: Pl3xmap Reflection
hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.text: Pushes a list of Maps for your current dimension from Pl3xmap to the stack

hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.title: Squaremap Reflection
hexcasting:casting/markers#hexmapping:ge.text: Pushes a list of Maps for your current dimension from Squaremap to the stack

hexcasting:imbuement/imbue_amel#lapiswor.title: Imbue with Amel
hexcasting:imbuement/imbue_amel#lapiswor.text: The spell the ancient "Lapisworkers" would use very often. Imbue the item in my other hand (or main if nothing imbueable is in the other hand) with the specified amount of Amel, with no waste like the Enchant X spells. Costs 2x the amount of Amel being infused, in dust.

hexcasting:imbuement/casting_rings#lapis.title: Amel Ring
hexcasting:imbuement/casting_rings#lapis.text: If I am dissatisfied with this ring, I can choose to imbue it with one piece of Amel. The Amel should stick to the Gold part. It'll start focusing and attracting media from my reserves to moderate speed that can either be picked up by a staff in my hand or eventually swing back towards the ring.

hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.title: Sieve Thoughts
hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.text: Sieves the torrent of information using the (full) artificial mind at the given position. 3/5 chance of replacing the pattern in my other hand with one of the correct stroke order.

hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.title: Cognition Purification
hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.text: Pushes the percentage filled of the mind container at the given position to the stack.

hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.title: Mind Liquefaction
hexcasting:imbuement/artificial_mind#lap.text: Absorbs the entirety of the mind within the container into the rechargeable item in my other hand. If there is any extra, it is discarded. A full container yields one Charged Amethyst.

hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:cre.title: Summon
hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:cre.text: Summons an enchanted version of the Greater Sentinel at the given position (which must be within 32 blocks around me) and the given ambit (which can be from 1-64). Costs 5 amethyst dust to summon.

hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:ban.title: Banish Own
hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:ban.text: Peacefully put my Enchanted Sentinel to rest for a negligible amount of media, letting it rest for a time. Perhaps the ethical option, considering "falling apart" may not be the most painless.

hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:ban.title: Banish Other's
hexcasting:great/enchsent#lapisworks:ban.text: Banish another's Enchanted Sentinel if it's at that block for 5 dust.

hexcasting:great/flay_artmind#lapisworks.title: Imbue Mind
hexcasting:great/flay_artmind#lapisworks.text: Takes the location of a block with limited functionality and a full Simple Mind Container, and imbues the mind into the construct for five charged amethyst. [*This shape reminds me of something..*](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/brainsweep)

hexcasting:great/flay_artmind#lapisworks.title: Teach Song
hexcasting:great/flay_artmind#lapisworks.text: Teach the Live Jukebox at that location these notes (a list of whole numbers 0-24) at this frequency (0-20). After being hit via Use, it plays the notes like an automatic Note Block.

hexcasting:great/hastenature#lapisworks:.title: Hastenature
hexcasting:great/hastenature#lapisworks:.text: Takes a block position and a positive number, and ages the block (or how I call it, induces a random tick) there that many times. Costs an amethyst shard per age-up.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:wish.title: Wish
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:wish.text: Wish the genie to cast a Hex for me. Because I am *teaching* a mind rather than *etching* a [casting device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), I can freely reteach the genie a new Hex any time without losing media.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Spatial
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Pushes my original position when I began using the Hand Lamp.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Rotational
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Pushes my original rotation when I began using the Hand Lamp.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Kinetic
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Pushes my original velocity when I began using the Hand Lamp.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Temporal
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Pushes how many times the Hand Lamp has cast since I began using the Hand Lamp. I can divide by by 20 to convert to seconds.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Media
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Pushes the remaining media of the Hand Lamp, in units of dust.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:set_h.title: Genie Gambit
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:set_h.text: Asks the genie to remember an iota for me. Strangely, the genie seems able to bypass the Transgress Others mishap, perhaps because it requires my active concentration to use this Hand Lamp.

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.title: Genie Refl.: Memory
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:get_h.text: Requests the iota I had saved to the genie to be pushed to the top of the stack. If I had not previously saved anything, the genie pushes [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences).

hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:lamp_.title: Finale Reflection
hexcasting:lamp/hand_lamps#hexical:lamp_.text: The instant I let go of my Hand Lamp, it casts an additional time. I can use this pattern to recognize whether a cast is that finale, and react accordingly.

hexcasting:lamp/genie_lore#hexical:recha.title: Refuel Lamp
hexcasting:lamp/genie_lore#hexical:recha.text: Refuels the Lamp in my offhand by the given amount in [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Costs just the media I'm giving the Lamp.

hexcasting:lamp/genie_lore#hexical:promo.title: Promote Lamp
hexcasting:lamp/genie_lore#hexical:promo.text: Hold the lamp in my other hand and cast. Costs about ten [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) and requires the sacrifice.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:has_a.title: Archgenie Purification
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:has_a.text: Pushes whether a player currently has an active [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps).

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Spatial
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Pushes my original position when the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) started casting.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Rotational
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Pushes my original rotation when the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) started casting.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Kinetic
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Pushes my original velocity when the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) started casting.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Temporal
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Pushes how many times the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) has cast since its activation. I can divide by by 20 to convert to seconds.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Media
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Pushes the remaining amount of media left in the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps), in units of dust.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:set_a.title: Archgenie Gambit
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:set_a.text: Can be cast by a [casting device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), [Staff](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff), or within the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) to remember an iota. Unlike Hand Lamp, this is subject to Transgress Others mishap.

hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.title: Arch. Refl.: Memory
hexcasting:lamp/arch_lamps#hexical:get_a.text: Can be cast by a [casting device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), [Staff](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff), or within the [Archgenie Lamp](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#lamp/arch_lamps) to push the stored iota.

hexcasting:items/amethyst#dust.title: Amethyst Dust
hexcasting:items/amethyst#dust.text: It seems that I'll find three different forms of amethyst when breaking a crystal inside a geode. The smallest denomination seems to be a small pile of shimmering dust, worth a relatively small amount of media.

hexcasting:items/amethyst#shard.title: Amethyst Shard
hexcasting:items/amethyst#shard.text: The second is a whole shard of amethyst, of the type non-Hexcasters might be used to. This has about as much media inside as five [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:items/amethyst#charged.title: Charged Amethyst
hexcasting:items/amethyst#charged.text: Finally, I'll rarely find a large crystal crackling with energy. This has about as much media inside as ten units of [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) (or two [Amethyst Shards](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)).

hexcasting:items/debugging#debugger.title: Debugger
hexcasting:items/debugging#debugger.text:
*Thwack!*
I can also switch between different "step modes" of the Debugger by sneak-scrolling (like with a [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) or [Abacus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/abacus)).

hexcasting:items/splicing_table#cost.title: Cost
hexcasting:items/splicing_table#cost.text:
Unfortunately, all of this incredible versatility comes at a cost. In order to modify the contents of items, media is required - about a tenth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per action performed.
I can supply media to the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) by putting it in the lower right slot. The table will consume up to ten [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) at once; any surplus is ignored until it can be consumed without wasting media.

hexcasting:items/splicing_table#splicing.title: Splicing Table
hexcasting:items/splicing_table#splicing.text: *She plugged in strings one after the other, the tiny metal cubes flying in and out as her fingers danced over the tray with blinding speed.*

hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:write_.title: Write Grimoire
hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:write_.text: Associates a pattern to a list of patterns in the Grimoire in my offhand.

hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:erase_.title: Erase Grimoire
hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:erase_.text: Erases any associations for a pattern that may exist in the Grimoire in my offhand.

hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:index_.title: Archivist Reflection
hexcasting:items/grimoire#hexical:index_.text: Gets a list of all patterns modified by the Grimoire in my offhand.

hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.title: Restore Scroll
hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.text: Restores the parchment of a scroll to an unmodified state.

hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.title: Age Scroll
hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.text: Yellows the parchment of an Animated Scroll, making it bear striking semblance to some ancient scrolls I've been finding.

hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.title: Vanish Scroll
hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.text: Causes the Animated Scroll to become invisible leaving only the pattern, making it appear as though the pattern were magically etched into the surface the scroll is on.

hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.title: Dye Ink
hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.text: Changes the color of an Animated Scroll's ink to the color specified by the vector, with the components being 0 to 1 values of red, green, and blue respectively.

hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.title: Illuminate Ink
hexcasting:items/animated_scroll#hexical.text: Causes the ink of an Animated Scroll to brightly glow, regardless of lighting conditions.

hexcasting:items/hexcasting#artifact.title: Artifact
hexcasting:items/hexcasting#artifact.text: *We have a saying in our field: "Magic isn't". It doesn't "just work," it doesn't respond to your thoughts, you can't throw fireballs or create a roast dinner from thin air or turn a bunch of muggers into frogs and snails.*

hexcasting:items/mindrender#oneironaut:a.title: Empower Mind Render
hexcasting:items/mindrender#oneironaut:a.text: Accepts an item or item frame bearing the Sharpness enchantment, and converts it into Mind Render of the same level. Cost is based on enchantment level, and increases by 50% if the item is a book.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Conduct Rod
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Acts just like [the spells used to program conventional casting items](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/hexcasting). Costs 10 Charged Amethyst.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Baton Reflection
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns my look vector from when I started the current cast loop.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Baton Reflection II
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns my eye position from when I started the current cast loop.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Metronome Reflection
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns the timestamp from when I started the current cast loop.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Metronome Gambit
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Accepts a positive integer. When cast with a Reverberation Rod, delays the current cast loop's next cast until that many twentieths of a second have passed.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Finale
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, forcibly halts the current cast loop.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Encore
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Accepts a positive integer. Halts the current cast loop but also reduces the cooldown period from 1 second to ((1/20) \* number) seconds. Cooldown due to mishap is unaffected.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Williams' Gambit
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Accepts a non-list iota, and stores it inside the current cast loop. It will be lost when the cast loop ends.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Williams' Reflection
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Returns the iota stored in the current cast loop. Defaults to NULL.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Conductor's Reflection
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Returns a boolean corresponding to whether the current cast is making use of a rod.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Williams' Gambit II
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: As Williams' Gambit, but can be cast from non-rod sources while a rod is in use.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Williams' Reflection II
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: As Williams' Reflection, but can be cast from non-rod sources while a rod is in use.

hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.title: Conductor's Reflection II
hexcasting:items/reverberation_rod#oneir.text: Returns whether the caster is currently using a rod, regardless of the current cast is from that rod.

hexcasting:items/periwinkle#hexical:peri.title: Induce Digging
hexcasting:items/periwinkle#hexical:peri.text: Fortunately, the Art of Hexcasting is a versatile one and provides the means to bring back near anything.

hexcasting:items/ballast#hexodus:alter_b.title: Alter Ballast
hexcasting:items/ballast#hexodus:alter_b.text: Commands a Ballast on my person to fall in a given direction with a given strength strength. Free.

hexcasting:items/whispering_stone#whispe.title: Whispering Stone
hexcasting:items/whispering_stone#whispe.text: After finalizing the construction of my [Librarian Impetus](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/listener_impetus@slate_work:listener), I have found my self needing to be able to "reach" it from further away. After a flash of genius, combining a slate, some amethyst dust as a binding agent, and an Echo Shard; I now have a device that can listen to what I say whenever I hold it and speak.

hexcasting:imbuing#hexchanting:imbue_equ.title: Imbue Equipment
hexcasting:imbuing#hexchanting:imbue_equ.text: Imbues the supplied hexes into the amethyst equipment in my other hand, so that they will be cast whenever the item is used. Costs 9 charged amethyst except on arrows, which cost 5 shards.

hexcasting:greatwork/flayrevival#oneiron.title: Instill Psyche
hexcasting:greatwork/flayrevival#oneiron.text: Accepts a flayed mob, and creates an artifical pseudo-mind to inhabit its body. Costs 16 charged amethyst when used on a villager or allay, or 10 amethyst shards for anything else.

hexcasting:greatwork/super_budding#oneir.title: Craft Bottomless Trinket
hexcasting:greatwork/super_budding#oneir.text: Writes a hex to the bottomless trinket in my other hand. Costs ten charged amethyst.

hexcasting:greatwork/sentinel_detection#.title: Scrutinize Sentinel
hexcasting:greatwork/sentinel_detection#.text: Accepts a vector and a player, and returns either the distance from the vector to the target player's sentinel or NULL. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:greatwork/listener_impetus#sl.title: Librarian Impetus
hexcasting:greatwork/listener_impetus#sl.text: The first design freed and conceptualized is the Librarian Impetus. This reuses the Librarian's extensive vocabulary into a tool to understand what I say out loud.

hexcasting:greatwork/ambit_loci#ambit_lo.title: Ambit Extender
hexcasting:greatwork/ambit_loci#ambit_lo.text:
The Ambit Extender is a fabulous answer to my Ambit woes when it comes to [Spell Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles). This pops a vector from the stack, and extends ambit in the direction (negative vectors extending the negative corner of Circle Ambit). 
*With great range comes with great costs, err-*

hexcasting:greatwork/broadcaster_loci#br.title: Iotic Door
hexcasting:greatwork/broadcaster_loci#br.text:
After close examination of the enigmatic gifted [Akashic Libraries](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib), I believe that I may recreate their iota storage for [Spell Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles); albeit, in a cruder manner. 
*"The door is open, if you're ready?" 
"No, not... not really, but..." 
\*sigh\* \*click\**

hexcasting:greatwork/mute_loci#mute_loci.title: Muffling Slate
hexcasting:greatwork/mute_loci#mute_loci.text:
While I work with [Spell Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) more and more, the constant *crackles* from the Media Wave has begun to ring in my ears. And with some of my more... esoteric [Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles), nearly deafening me. 
Luckily, this, the Muffling Slate, can protect my ears from the obnoxious sounds and noises.

hexcasting:greatwork/crafting_loci#craft.title: Patterned Assembler
hexcasting:greatwork/crafting_loci#craft.text:
Oh how my hands *Ache* and *Buzz* from countless hours of slaving over a Crafting Table... luckily these days are over. The Patterned Assembler solves these pains and problems. 
*Items ever deeper in items, I cant stop crafting, I cant stop looking; more items must be crafted and automated. NOW*.

hexcasting:greatwork/hotbar_loci#hotbar_.title: Pocket Simulator
hexcasting:greatwork/hotbar_loci#hotbar_.text:
The Pocket Simulator solves my inventory woes!
Using an Allay as the core of it, it can hold up to 6 "stacks" of items, playfully dancing around the Simulator. As well, I can denote 1 of those stacks to being a [held item](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/itempicking), meaning blockwork spells will pull from that first.

hexcasting:greatwork/save_loci#save_loci.title: Restoration Mainframe
hexcasting:greatwork/save_loci#save_loci.text: This works by "swapping" the internal stored state with the current running state. So whenever it is activated by a [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles), it will exchange the 2 states. Additionally, it seems like this stored state does not remember its "orignal" [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles), so it can be traded between [Spell Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) if proper application of [Directrices](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/directrix) are used.

hexcasting:greatwork/sentinel_loci#senti.title: Sentinel Cache
hexcasting:greatwork/sentinel_loci#senti.text: This agglomeration of minds, twisted, pulled, shattered, and mended. I *hear* them, yet no sound is made, I *hear* their pain. Several minds ripped and combined into a block. All for my gain... But- the way the light shimmers and dances off of the slate foundation, the wetted amethyst's gleam... *It calls to me*

hexcasting:greatwork/macro_loci#macro_lo.title: Spell Imprinter
hexcasting:greatwork/macro_loci#macro_lo.text: During my travels I have heard mutterances about things called "macros," patterns that represent larger Hexes (I believe these to be linked to a possible [Akashic Library](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib)?). Nonetheless, I am able to recreate these "macros" with Spell Circles using the Spell Imprinter, and an iota written inside of a [any iota holder](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus) placed on top of the Imprinter.

hexcasting:greatwork/storage_loci_block#.title: Storage Vessel
hexcasting:greatwork/storage_loci_block#.text:
After *FAR TOO LONG* of lugging my items in clunky, splintery, *chests*... I have discovered the perfect method of storage, Storage Vessels. 
Despite my current state, I am still far too full of mental garbage to interface with the Storage Vessels. However, [Spell Circles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) are perfect for insertion and extraction of these new storage methods.

hexcasting:greatwork/speed_loci#speed_lo.title: Wave Regulator
hexcasting:greatwork/speed_loci#speed_lo.text: As I begin to explore the uses of the [Great Work](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles), I find my self needing more control over these fascinating possibilities. So I have created the Wave Regulator; what this does is it pops a number from the stack, and attempts to set the "speed" of the wave. More specifically, how many 20ths of a second the wave should wait before going to the next slate.

hexcasting:interop/fabric_only_hexal#hex.title: Phase Block
hexcasting:interop/fabric_only_hexal#hex.text: Takes a position and a number, and phases the block at that position out for that many seconds. Costs one ten-thousandth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) times the square of the time to phase out for.

hexcasting:interop/pehkui#hexcasting:int.title: Gulliver's Purification
hexcasting:interop/pehkui#hexcasting:int.text: Get the scale of the entity, as a proportion of their normal size. For most entities, this will be 1.

hexcasting:interop/pehkui#hexcasting:int.title: Alter Scale
hexcasting:interop/pehkui#hexcasting:int.text: Set the scale of the entity, passing in a proportion of their normal size. Costs about 1 Amethyst Shard.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:rota.title: Ferris Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:rota.text: Rotates the array leftward: an argument of 1 moves the first item of the list to the end. Negative numbers allow rotating the list rightward.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:take.title: Retention Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:take.text: Selects the first few elements from the input list. If the number is negative, selects the last few elements instead.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:drop.title: Rejection Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:drop.text: Drops the first few elements from the input list; the dual to [Retention Distillation](https://hexic.pool.net.eu.org/v/1.4.2/1.0/en_us#addon/hexic/lists2@hexic:take/count).

hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:take.title: Retention Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:take.text: Selects from the list only elements corresponding to the given indices. Unlike [Selection Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/lists@hexcasting:index), this cannot reorder or duplicate iotas.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:drop.title: Rejection Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/lists2#hexic:drop.text: Drops from the list iotas at the given indices. All other iotas are kept in the same order as the input.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.title: Mind's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.text: Adds me, the caster, to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:en.title: Compass' Purification
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:en.text: Transforms an entity on the stack into the position of its eyes. I should probably use this on myself.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:en.title: Compass' Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:en.text: Transforms an entity on the stack into the position it is standing. I should probably use this on other entities.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.title: Alidade's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.text: Transforms an entity on the stack into the direction it's looking in, as a unit vector.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.title: Archer's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.text: Combines two vectors (a position and a direction) into the answer to the question: If I stood at the position and looked in the direction, what block would I be looking at? Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.title: Architect's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.text: Like [Archer's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast), but instead returns a vector representing the answer to the question: Which *side* of the block am I looking at? Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.title: Scout's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ra.text: Like [Archer's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast), but instead returns the *entity* I am looking at. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:pr.title: Reveal
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:pr.text: Displays the top iota of the stack to me.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.title: Stadiometer's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.text: Transforms an entity on the stack into its height.

hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.title: Pace Purification
hexcasting:patterns/basics#hexcasting:ge.text: Transforms an entity on the stack into the direction in which it's moving, with the speed of that movement as that direction's magnitude.

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.title: Debugger's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.text: Add True to the top of the stack if executed by a [Debugger](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@debugger) or [Evaluator](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@evaluator), or False otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:n.title: Debug Locator's Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:n.text: Add the index of the next iota to be evaluated if executed by a [Debugger](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@debugger) or [Evaluator](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@evaluator), or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.title: Cognitohazard Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.text: Add a Cognitohazard to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:b.title: Set Breakpoint Before
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:b.text: Pause the [Debugger](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@debugger) before executing this pattern.

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:b.title: Set Breakpoint After
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:b.text: Pause the [Debugger](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@debugger) after executing this pattern (ie. before executing the next pattern).

hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.title: Craft Debugger
hexcasting:patterns/debugging#hexdebug:c.text:
Create a [Debugger](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/debugging@debugger) that casts a Hex, similar to [certain other patterns](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/hexcasting) I've used in the past.
Costs about ten [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_patterns.title: Epiphany Purification
hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_patterns.text: Pushes whether the given player has achieved Enlightenment.

hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_patterns.title: Sentience Purification
hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_patterns.text: Pushes whether an entity has been "magically relieved of its mind". I feel this is strongly related to [Flay Mind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/brainsweep) somehow...

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:sekh.title: Sekhmet' Gambit
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:sekh.text: Voids the entire stack except for the top n iota, determined by tail length. In the examples above, zero, one, and two iota are left untouched respectively.

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:geb.title: Geb's Gambit
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:geb.text: Yanks the iota n from the top up to the top, determined by tail length. In the examples above, the iota second, third, and fourth from the top are yanked respectively.

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:nut.title: Nut's Gambit
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:nut.text: Sinks the top iota n from the top, determined by tail length. In the examples above, the iota is moved to the second, third, and fourth place from the top respectively.

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:swap.title: Reflecting Gambit
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:swap.text: Reflects the order of the top three iota, turning A, B, C into C, B, A. Essentially swaps the top and the third-from-the-top iota.

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:swap.title: Bubbling Gambit
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:swap.text: Causes the third-from-the-top iota to bubble up over the second-from-the-top iota, essentially swapping them.

hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:dup_.title: Dioscuri Gambit II
hexcasting:extra_stack#overevaluate:dup_.text: Takes a number and duplicates that many elements of the stack while preserving order.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:r.title: Read Glyphs
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:r.text:
Read all glyphs from a given entity: could be an item like glyph, spellcaster and parchment, or item frames containing those, or a player with learnt glyphs.
This could be the only way to obtain a glyph iota if I choose to deny the evil power of HexParse.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.title: Cast Spell
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.text:
Cast the given spell from myself.
Costs 1 dust for each glyph used.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.title: Projectile Spell
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.text:
Cast the given spell as a projectile shooting from certain position & angle. One Glyph of Projectile will be inserted before the given glyphs.
Costs 1 shard plus 1 dust for each glyph used.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.title: Touch Spell
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.text:
Cast the given spell on given entity or position. One Glyph of Touch will be inserted before the given glyphs.
Costs 1 shard plus 1 dust for each glyph used.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.title: Delegated Spell
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:c.text:
Cast the given spell from the given TrueName.
Costs 1 charged crystal for each glyph used.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:s.title: Register Callback
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:s.text: Register the given spell list as callback, which will be executed when "Trigger Callback" glyph executes.

hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:g.title: Get Current Callback
hexcasting:glyph_patterns#hex_ars_link:g.text: Read the callback spell list registered.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/greater_reveal#he.title: Greater Reveal
hexcasting:addon/hexic/greater_reveal#he.text: Takes a list of iotas (or a single non-iota, which is treated as a list with one element) and displays them permanently to the caster. Displayed iotas survive all methods that would clear a normal Reveal, and can only be cleared by another casting of Greater Reveal.

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:pure_map.title: Pure Thoth
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:pure_map.text: Similar to [Thoth's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each), but won't copy the original stack inside each sub-execution.

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:pure_reduce.title: Conway's Gambit
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:pure_reduce.text: Similar to [Thoth's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each); for data list with length **n**, it executes **n - 1** times; The first initial stack is the first two elements, and each subsequent execution uses the stack after the last execution.

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:build_nested.title: Build Nested
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:build_nested.text: Copy list #0 and set back to index #1

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:nested_modify.title: Transplant's Exaltation
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:nested_modify.text: List iota #0 is the nested list to be modified. According to the index sequence given by list #1, traverses to the inner layer, and sets the corresponding element to iota #2.

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:noob_num.title: Noob Num Reflection
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:noob_num.text: The starting cumulative number is 0; putting the initial direction to →, all ↗ makes the result **\* 2 + 1**, all → makes it **\* 2**, and all ↘ for **/ 10**. Starting with the patterns on the right negates the result.

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:mass_rotate.title: Mass Rotation Gambit
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:mass_rotate.text: Accepts the size to reorder and a bottom-to-top order list, and do the corresponding reorder to the rest of the stack. For example, **3** plus **[1,2,0]** for [Rotation Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/stackmanip@hexcasting:rotate), and **2** plus **[0,1,0,1]** for [Dioscuri Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/stackmanip@hexcasting:2dup)

hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:weak_escape.title: Contemplation
hexcasting:hexflow#hexflow:weak_escape.text: Same as [Consideration](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:escape), but with lowest execution priority, and won't grow in **2^n** formula exponentially inside nested [Intro-Retro](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren)s

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:fo.title: Encoding Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:fo.text:
Reads data from the focus I'm holding, and prints parsed code into chat menu.
Can only be casted by staff.

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:co.title: Decoding Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:co.text:
Reads code from my local clipboard, then parse it into the focus I'm holding.
Can only be casted by staff.

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:le.title: Learn Great Patterns
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:le.text: Extract great patterns from handheld items (ancient scrolls, focuses, compiled casting items, etc.), and returns a list of newly learned ones by the parser.

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:re.title: No-Comment Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:re.text: Clears all comment iotas in a list, returns processed list.

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:cr.title: Line-Break Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:cr.text: Adds a line-break comment iota with space-indents of given number to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:co.title: Compile
hexcasting:patterns/hexparse#hexparse:co.text: Compiles accepted string iota into an iota list; has no effect if **MoreIotas** not installed.

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:c.title: Timekeeper's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:c.text: Adds a number to the stack which seems to be related to how Nature represents time; If I cast the pattern, then cast the same pattern a second later, the number it adds has increased by 20.

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:b.title: Diver's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:b.text: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much breath it has left (i.e., how close it is to drowning).

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:h.title: Nurse's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:h.text: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much health it has left (i.e., how close it is to dying).

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:a.title: Squire's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:a.text: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much armour it has.

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:t.title: Boxer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:t.text: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much toughness it has (another property of armour).

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:l.title: Lamplighter's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_basics#hexal:l.text: Removes a position vector from the stack and returns the light level at that position.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/metatables#hexic:.title: Patchwork Exaltation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/metatables#hexic:.text: Constructs a Patchwork iota from the userdata (iota stored inside), display iota (visible to my eyes), color, and an overload map.

hexcasting:jumble#overevaluate:create_ju.title: Jumbling Gambit
hexcasting:jumble#overevaluate:create_ju.text: Creates a jumble iota corresponding to the argument count and the list of numbers.

hexcasting:jumble#overevaluate:dissolve_.title: Jumbling Decomposition
hexcasting:jumble#overevaluate:dissolve_.text: Dissolves a jumble iota back into a number and a list of numbers.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexic:empty_.title: Vacant Reflection: Map
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexic:empty_.text: Creates a new empty map for my usage.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:a.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:a.text: Merges two maps together. Maps cannot have duplicate items: any entry in the latter map will override that in the first map.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:s.title: Subtractive Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:s.text: Removes every entry in the first map that is found in the second map. The values in the second map are ignored.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:i.title: Selection Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:i.text: Disintegrates the map, returning only the value associated with the given key. O(1), unlike scanning a list.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:u.title: Derivation Decomposition
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:u.text: Shaves off one element of a map. Which element gets shaved off is undefined and subject to Nature's whims. If used on an empty map, returns two nulls.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:r.title: Surgeon's Exaltation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:r.text: Replaces the element associated with __k__ with __v__. If __k__ is not present in the map, the entry is created.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:r.title: Excisor's Distillation
hexcasting:addon/hexic/maps#hexcasting:r.text: Throws out the map's association for the given key. If there is no matching association, the map is returned unchanged.

hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_splicing.title: Imbue Mindsplice Table
hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_splicing.text:
Remove a vector and list of patterns from the stack, then imbue the list of patterns into the [Mindsplice Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#greatwork/enlightened_splicing_table) at that position.
Costs about five [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_splicing.title: Mindsplice Purification
hexcasting:patterns/enlightened_splicing.text: Remove a vector from the stack, then push the Hex currently imbued to the [Mindsplice Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#greatwork/enlightened_splicing_table) at that position, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it has not yet been imbued.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Byte
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into a Byte tag: an integer between -128 and 127, inclusive.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Short
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into a Short tag, between -65536 and 65535.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Integer
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into an Int tag, between roughly negative 2 billion and positive 2 billion.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Long
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into a Long tag: bounded to 9 quintillion, which I will likely never reach.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Double
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into a Double tag. Oddly, doubles seem to perfectly correspond to my knowledge of numbers, plus the ability to represent infinities and non-numbers.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.title: Secretary's Purification: Float
hexcasting:addon/hexic/nbt#hexic:nbt/lif.text: Converts a number into a Float tag. These seem similar to Doubles, albeit with less precision.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/no#hexic:whatthef.title: Suffering
hexcasting:addon/hexic/no#hexic:whatthef.text: How could one even begin to draw this?

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:yjsp_med.title: YJSP's Charge Media
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:yjsp_med.text: Charges the current casting environment to an equivalent of **114514** amethyst dust media.

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:get_pers.title: Mana Reflection
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:get_pers.text: Gets how much media exists in my personal media bar (in **0.0001** dust).

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:get_pers.title: Arcane Reflection
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:get_pers.text: Gets how much media I could hold in my personal media bar at most (in **0.0001** dust).

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_pat.title: Snapshot Reflection
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_pat.text: Gets the list of all pattern iotas in the current staff canvas, returned in the order they were drawn.

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.title: Brain-Out Gambit
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.text: Pops the top iota from the staff casting stack, and pushes into current stack.

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.title: Brain-In Gambit
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.text: Pops the top iota from current stack, and pushes into the staff casting stack.

hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.title: Brain Depth's Reflection
hexcasting:pages#hexoverpowered:mind_sta.text: Gets the size of the staff casting stack.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.title: Chronicler's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.text: Like [Scribe's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:read), but the iota is read out of a block instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.title: Chronicler's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.text:
Like [Scribe's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:write), but the iota is written to a block instead of my other hand.
Interestingly enough, it looks like I cannot write my own Name using this spell. I get a sense that I might be endangered if I could.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#iot.title: Tachygrapher's Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#iot.text:
Read a list iota out of an entity or block, then push the iota at the specified index to the stack.
It seems this and the next pattern may be useful for handling large amounts of data without causing a [Too Many Iotas](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/mishaps) mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#iot.title: Tachygrapher's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#iot.text: Read a list iota out of an entity or block, then set the element at the specified index of that list to the given iota, then write the resulting list back to the entity or block.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.title: Auditor's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.text: Like [Auditor's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:readable), but the readability of a block is checked instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.title: Assessor's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite_blocks#hex.text: Like [Assessor's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:writable), but the writability of a block is checked instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Sprocket's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector from the stack, then push the index of the leftmost iota currently visible in the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Sprocket's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector and number from the stack, then move the view of the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position so that the given index is the leftmost one visible.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Splicer's Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector from the stack, then push two values representing the current selection in the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Splicer's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector and two values from the stack, then set the selection of the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position as previously described.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Compositor's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector from the stack, then copy the contents of the secondary item in the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position and push it to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Compositor's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text:
Remove a vector and iota from the stack, then save the iota into the secondary item in the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position.
As with [Chronicler's Gambit](https://ioticblocks.hexxy.media/v/1.0.2+1.20.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite_blocks@hexcasting:write/entity), I cannot write my own Name using this spell.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Producer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Replace the vector at the top of the stack with True if there is a [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position containing a secondary item that I could read, or False otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Director's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Replace the vector at the top of the stack with True if there is a [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) at that position containing a secondary item that I could save an iota into, or False otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Projectionist's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector from the stack, then push the current page number (starting at 1) of the [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in the main slot of the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) or [Focal Frame](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/focus_holder) at that position.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Projectionist's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Remove a vector and number from the stack, then flip the [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in the main slot of the [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) or [Focal Frame](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/focus_holder) at that position to the given page number.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Shutter's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Replace the vector at the top of the stack with True if there is a [Splicing Table](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/splicing_table) or [Focal Frame](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#items/focus_holder) at that position with a [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in its main slot that contains at least one page, or False otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Projectionist's Prfn. II
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Like [Projectionist's Purification](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#patterns/splicing_table@hexdebug:splicing/list/spellbook_index/read), but the page number of the [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in the secondary slot is read instead of the main slot.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Projectionist's Gambit II
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Like [Projectionist's Gambit](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#patterns/splicing_table@hexdebug:splicing/list/spellbook_index/write), but the page number of the [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in the secondary slot is written instead of the main slot.

hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.title: Shutter's Prfn. II
hexcasting:patterns/splicing_table#hexde.text: Like [Shutter's Purification](https://hexdebug.hexxy.media/v/0.7.0+1.20.1/1.1/en_us#patterns/splicing_table@hexdebug:splicing/list/spellbook_index/readable), but the [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in the secondary slot is checked instead of the main slot.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/staffcast#hexic:s.title: Lani's Greater Gambit
hexcasting:addon/hexic/staffcast#hexic:s.text: Coerces my staff to cast a Hex. The hex uses the stack of the outer casting environment.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/staffcast#hexic:s.title: Lani's Lesser Gambit
hexcasting:addon/hexic/staffcast#hexic:s.text: Coerces my staff to cast a Hex. The hex uses the stack of the staff itself, but keeps the outer environment's ravenmind.

hexcasting:addon/hexic/addendum/strings#.title: Murmur Reflection
hexcasting:addon/hexic/addendum/strings#.text: Adds the phrase on the *tip of my tongue* to the stack, regardless of whether I intend to say it.

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Submit Iota
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Sends the iota on the top of the stack into the ether to be received by my current avatar. Can fail for [various reasons](https://penguinencounter.github.io/mediatransport/v/1.1.0+1.20.1/2.0/en_us#interop/figura/mishaps). Always costs a fixed 1 'sending power.'

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Accept Iota
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Retrieves the next iota from the inbound queue, or [mishaps](https://penguinencounter.github.io/mediatransport/v/1.1.0+1.20.1/2.0/en_us#interop/figura/mishaps) if the queue is empty.

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Semaphore's Refl.
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Queries the number of iotas in the queue.

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Submit Iota II
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Sends the iota on the top of the stack to be received by the player second from the top of the stack. It seems to have a separate receiver from the other one. Usually costs 2 'sending power', but this could be different depending on the server configuration.

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Quota's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Queries the amount of 'sending power' remaining.

hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.title: Query Configuration
hexcasting:patterns/figura#mediatranspor.text: Asks Nature to send information about its preferences to my current avatar. Costs 1 'spending power'. See [the protocol documentation](https://penguinencounter.github.io/mediatransport/v/1.1.0+1.20.1/2.0/en_us#mediatransport_virtual/protocol) for details.

hexcasting:patterns/numbers#Numbers.title: Numerical Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/numbers#Numbers.text: Irritatingly, there is no easy way to draw numbers. Here is the method Nature deigned to give us.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:mul.title: Multiplicative Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:mul.text: Perform multiplication or the dot product.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:div.title: Division Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:div.text: Perform division or the cross product.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:abs.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:abs.text: Compute the absolute value or length.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:floo.title: Floor Purification
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:floo.text: "Floors" a number, cutting off the fractional component and leaving an integer value. If passed a vector, instead floors each of its components.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:ceil.title: Ceiling Purification
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:ceil.text: "Ceilings" a number, raising it to the next integer value if it has a fractional component. If passed a vector, instead ceils each of its components.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:cons.title: Vector Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:cons.text: Combine three numbers at the top of the stack into a vector's X, Y, and Z components (bottom to top).

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:deco.title: Vector Disintegration
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:deco.text: Split a vector into its X, Y, and Z components (bottom to top).

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:modu.title: Modulus Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:modu.text: Takes the modulus of two numbers. This is the amount *remaining* after division - for example, 5 % 2 is 1, and 5 % 3 is 2. When applied on vectors, performs the above operation elementwise.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:coer.title: Axial Purification
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:coer.text: For a vector, coerce it to its nearest axial direction, a unit vector. For a number, return the sign of the number; 1 if positive, -1 if negative. In both cases, zero is unaffected.

hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:rand.title: Entropy Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/math#hexcasting:rand.text: Creates a random number between 0 and 1.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: True Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds True to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: False Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds False to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Nullary Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds the [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) influence to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Vector Rfln. +X/-X
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [1, 0, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [-1, 0, 0].

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Vector Rfln. +Y/-Y
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 1, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, -1, 0].

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Vector Rfln. +Z/-Z
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, 1]; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, -1].

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Circle's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds τ, the radial representation of a complete circle, to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Arc's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds π, the radial representation of half a circle, to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.title: Euler's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/consts#hexcasting:co.text: Adds *e*, the base of natural logarithms, to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Spatial Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text: Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the dimension I am currently in. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Spatial Reflection II
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text: Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the dimension my sentinel is currently in. Costs one-tenth of an amethyst dust.

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Homeland Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text: Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the overworld. Costs one-tenth of an amethyst dust.

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Inferno Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text:
Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the nether. Costs one-tenth of an amethyst dust.
There seems to be some resistance when I cast this. Perhaps I'll be able to overcome it with greater skill...

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Atlas' Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text: Accepts a Spatial Imprint, and returns the lowest and highest altitudes at which blocks can exist in the corresponding dimension.

hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.title: Ratio Purification
hexcasting:patterns/dim_iotas#oneironaut.text: Accepts a Spatial Imprint, and returns how many blocks you'd have to travel in the overworld to travel the equivalent of one block in the input dimension.

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:fa.title: Factorial Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:fa.text: Takes a number from the stack and computes its factorial, for example inputting 4 would return 4\*3\*2\*1=24.

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:ru.title: Running Sum Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:ru.text: Takes a list from the stack and computes its running sum, for example inputting [1,2,5] would return [1,3,8].

hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:ru.title: Running Product Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/hexal_maths#hexal:ru.text: Takes a list from the stack and computes its running product, for example inputting [1,2,5] would return [1,2,10].

hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.title: Progress Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.text: Turns the spellbook that your are holding one page to the right

hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.title: Regress Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.text: Turns the spellbook that your are holding one page to the left

hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.title: Heket's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_utility#he.text: Removes a pattern list from the stack. Examines (but does not remove) the iota beneath it, and evaluates the pattern list if and only if [Augur's Purification](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/logic@hexcasting:bool_coerce) would respond to that iota with True. Examination and evaluation repeats until the iota would no longer create truth.

hexcasting:patterns/hashing#ephemera:has.title: Hashing Purification
hexcasting:patterns/hashing#ephemera:has.text: Accepts any iota, and converts it into its hashed form.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Decorator's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts an item frame entity, and returns its rotation, from 0 to 7.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Decorator's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts an item frame entity and an integer from 0 to 7, and sets its rotation to the number. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Scout's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: As [Scout's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast/entity), but also accepts a list of entity type iotas. Any entity whose type is not present in the list will be ignored. Costs an amount of media slightly less negligible than that of the aforementioned pattern.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Entropy Reflection II
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Returns a random number with a gaussian distribution, with a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Clearance Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts a vector, and returns whether that vector is within (or just on the edge of) the block in that space. Seems to involve the boxes I see in my mind's eye.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Flock's Rfln. II
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Returns the total size of all iotas on my stack, including the contents of lists and similar. If this number ever reaches 1024, my stack shall come crashing down into garbage.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Flock's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts any iota, and returns its total size.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: State Purification
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts a vector, and returns a list of strings corresponding to values contained in the state of the block at the corresponding position.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: State Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts a vector and a string, and uses the string as a key to retrieve the value it corresponds to in the target block's state, or null if there is no corresponding value.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Ride Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts one of my wisps (or a wandering wisp), and places me atop it, similar to sitting in a minecart. I must be within the wisp's ambit, or four blocks for wandering wisps. Costs one amethyst shard.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Dismount
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Takes me off of whatever entity I may be riding when cast. Costs 1/100 of a dust.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Equestrian Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts an entity, and returns a list of entities seated atop it.

hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.title: Equestrian Prfn. II
hexcasting:patterns/misc_patterns#epheme.text: Accepts an entity, and returns the entity it is seated atop.

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Glyphmaker's Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Uses the number to shuffle the pattern into one of the same shape, but different stroke order. My notes hint that ancient Hexcasters used this for some *grand library*.

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Congruence Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Pushes whether two patterns have the same shape, stroke order, and orientation.

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Similarity Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Pushes whether two patterns have same shape but not necessarily the same stroke order.

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Chirographer's Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Turns a pattern into a list of numbers for my splitting, analysis, and dissection. The inverse of [Calligrapher's Purification](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/pattern_manipulation@hexical:deserialize_pattern).

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Calligrapher's Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Turns a list of numbers into a pattern for my viewing and execution. The inverse of [Chirographer's Purification](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/pattern_manipulation@hexical:serialize_pattern).

hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.title: Handwriting Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/pattern_manipulation.text: Takes a pattern and produces a normalized list of vectors. The z-component of these vectors is zero. I feel this may be useful for artistic Hexes.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Apothecary's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a living entity, and returns a list of status iotas representing all effects on the target.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Apothecary's Prfn. II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a status effect type, and returns a number based on whether the effect is likely to be helpful, harmful, or neutral to a creature.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Pharmacist's Dstln.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and returns the effect on the target's duration in seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Pharmacist's Distillation II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and returns the effect on the target's potency.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Entity Distillation: Status
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a status effect type and a vector, and returns an entity at that position which has that effect.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Zone Exltn.: Status
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a status effect type, a vector, and a number (*n*), and returns a list of entities within radius *n* of the vector which have that effect.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Zone Exltn.: Not-Status
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a status effect type, a vector, and a number (*n*), and returns a list of entities within radius *n* of the vector which do not have that effect.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Ablation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts a living entity, and returns how much damage it can Absorb before its health is affected.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.title: Cleanse Status
hexcasting:patterns/spells/status_iotas#.text: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and removes that status effect from the entity. Cost is based on the effect's innate harmfulness, its potency, and its remaining duration.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:c.title: Reading Purification
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:c.text: Takes an iota and returns a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) representing it. If taking a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas), strips all the styles of it.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Pushes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) of the first followed immediately by the second.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:s.title: Glyph Purification
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:s.text: Splits a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) into a list of individual glyphs.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:c.title: Collage Purification
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:c.text: Transforms all the elements of a list into text (or keeps them if they were) and pastes it all together.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Selection Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Pushes the nth glyph in the text.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Selection Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Pushes the specified slice of the text.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Surgeon's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Replaces the glyph at the nth position in the text with another segment of text. Replacement can be longer than one glyph.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Excisor's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Removes the nth glyph in the text.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.title: Uniqueness Purification
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexcastin.text: Keeps only the first instance of any glyph in the text. Styling is enough to distinguish a glyph.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Lumière Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and a color encoded as a vector whose components range from 0 to 1, and produces a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) of that color.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Gothic Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and sets whether it is **bold**.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Manutius' Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and sets whether it is in *italics*.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Notetaker's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and sets whether it is __underlined__.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Editor's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and sets whether it has been ~~struck through~~.

hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.title: Censor's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/text_iotas#hexpose:t.text: Takes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) and sets whether it is obfusca||ted||.

hexcasting:patterns/traces#hextrace:trac.title: Apply Trace
