hexcasting:patterns/traces#hextrace:trac.text: Applies the given trace to the top Iota.

hexcasting:patterns/metathoth#ephemera:t.title: Seshat's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/metathoth#ephemera:t.text: Pops an iota from the accumulator and pushes it to the current stack. Mishaps if used outside of Thoth's Gambit.

hexcasting:patterns/metathoth#ephemera:t.title: Seshat's Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/metathoth#ephemera:t.text: Returns how many iotas are currently accessible via Seshat's Gambit. Returns -1 if used outside of Thoth's Gambit.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Novice's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text:
Removes the first iota from the stack.
This seems to be a special case of [Bookkeeper's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/stackmanip@hexcasting:mask).

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Jester's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Swaps the top two iotas of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Rotation Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Yanks the iota third from the top of the stack to the top. [0, 1, 2] becomes [1, 2, 0].

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Rotation Gambit II
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Yanks the top iota to the third position. [0, 1, 2] becomes [2, 0, 1].

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Gemini Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Duplicates the top iota of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Prospector's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Copy the second-to-last iota of the stack to the top. [0, 1] becomes [0, 1, 0].

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Undertaker's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Copy the top iota of the stack, then put it under the second iota. [0, 1] becomes [1, 0, 1].

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Gemini Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Removes the number at the top of the stack, then copies the top iota of the stack that number of times. (A count of 2 results in two of the iota on the stack, not three.)

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Dioscuri Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Copy the top two iotas of the stack. [0, 1] becomes [0, 1, 0, 1].

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Flock's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Pushes the size of the stack as a number to the top of the stack. (For example, a stack of [0, 1] will become [0, 1, 2].)

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Fisherman's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Grabs the element in the stack indexed by the number and brings it to the top. If the number is negative, instead moves the top element of the stack down that many elements.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Fisherman's Gambit II
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Like [Fisherman's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/stackmanip@hexcasting:fisherman), but instead of moving the iota, copies it.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Bookkeeper's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: An infinite family of actions that keep or remove elements at the top of the stack based on the sequence of dips and lines.

hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.title: Swindler's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/stackmanip#hexcastin.text: Rearranges the top elements of the stack based on the given numerical code, which is the index of the permutation wanted.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:get_windo.title: Periphery Reflection
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:get_windo.text: Returns the full width and height of my vision as a vector.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:get_icons.title: Icons Reflection
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:get_icons.text: Pushes a list of the indices of all the Icons I have. This appears as a list of numbers.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_text.title: Draw Text
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_text.text: Takes an index, a position, a number, and any iota. Conjures an Icon displaying that iota.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:rotate_ic.title: Rotate Icon
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:rotate_ic.text: Takes an index and an amount of rotation counterclockwise in terms of a full circle. Rotates the icon.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:scale_ico.title: Scale Icon
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:scale_ico.text: Takes an index and a scaling factor. Scales the icon.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_rect.title: Draw Rectangle
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_rect.text: Takes an index, a position, a size, and a color. Conjures an Icon displaying that rectangle.

hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_line.title: Draw Line
hexcasting:scryglass#scryglass:draw_line.text: Takes an index, a position, a size, and a color. Conjures an Icon that joins between the two with a thin line.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:boo.title: Augur's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:boo.text: Convert an argument to a boolean. The number 0, [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences), False, and the empty list become False; everything else becomes True.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:abs.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:abs.text: Convert a boolean to a number; True becomes 1, and False becomes 0.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:not.title: Negation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:not.text: If the argument is True, return False; if it is False, return True.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:or.title: Disjunction Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:or.text: Returns True if at least one of the arguments are True; otherwise returns False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:and.title: Conjunction Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:and.text: Returns True if both arguments are true; otherwise returns False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:xor.title: Exclusion Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:xor.text: Returns True if exactly one of the arguments is true; otherwise returns False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:if.title: Augur's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:if.text: If the first argument is True, keeps the second and discards the third; otherwise discards the second and keeps the third.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:equ.title: Equality Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:equ.text: If the first argument equals the second (within a small tolerance), return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:not.title: Inequality Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:not.text: If the first argument does not equal the second (outside a small tolerance), return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:gre.title: Maximus Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:gre.text: If the first argument is greater than the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:les.title: Minimus Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:les.text: If the first argument is less than the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:gre.title: Maximus Distillation II
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:gre.text: If the first argument is greater than or equal to the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:les.title: Minimus Distillation II
hexcasting:patterns/logic#hexcasting:les.text: If the first argument is less than or equal to the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.title: Classifier's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.text: Remove an iota from the stack, and adds the type of that iota to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.title: Physician's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.text: Remove an entity from the stack, and adds the type of the entity at that location to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.title: Sorter's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.text: Remove an iota with an associated item type (for example a location and the type of the block at that location, an item entity, or an item frame) from the stack and returns the item type to the stack (e.g. Grass, Stone, Stick, etc.).

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.title: Sorter's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:type.text: Adds the type of the item in the caster's offhand to the stack if there is one present, or the type of the casting hand otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:get_.title: Entity Distillation: Type
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:get_.text: Remove an entity type and a position from the stack, and returns an entity of that type at that position if one exists.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:zone.title: Zone Exaltation: Type
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:zone.text: Remove an entity type, a position, and a radius from the stack, and returns a list of all entities of that type within that radius of that position.

hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:zone.title: Zone Exaltation: Not-Type
hexcasting:patterns/types#moreiotas:zone.text: Remove an entity type, a position, and a radius from the stack, and returns a list of all entities not of that type within that radius of that position

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Purification
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the entity at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Prfn.: Animal
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the animal at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Prfn.: Monster
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the monster at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Prfn.: Item
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the dropped item at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Prfn.: Player
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the player at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Entity Prfn.: Living
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Transform the position on the stack into the living creature at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Animal
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of animals near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Animal
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-animal entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Monster
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of monsters near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Monster
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-monster entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Item
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of dropped items near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Item
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-dropped-item entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Player
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of players near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Player
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-player characters near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Living
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of living creatures near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Living
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-living entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.title: Zone Dstl.: Any
hexcasting:patterns/entities#hexcasting:.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of all entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:type.title: Sorter's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:type.text: Transforms the [Item Stack](https://moreiotas.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1/1.0/en_us#casting/item_iotas) at the top of the stack into its Item.

hexcasting:patterns/items#hexcasting:abs.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/items#hexcasting:abs.text: Transforms the Item Stack at the top of the stack into its size.

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.title: Duelist's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.text: Transforms the entity at the top of the stack into the Item Stack in its main hand. Also works on Item Frames and dropped items.

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.title: Shieldbearer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.text: Transforms the entity at the top of the stack into the Item Stack in its off hand.

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.title: Hoarder's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.text: Removes two vectors from the stack representing position and side. Returns a list of Item Stacks in the block at the given position accessible from the given side (or all if second vector is zero).

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.title: Collector's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.text: Removes two vectors from the stack representing position and side. Returns a list of Items in the block at the given position accessible from the given side (or all if second vector is zero).

hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.title: Treasurer's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/items#moreiotas:item.text: Removes the number at the top of the stack, then sets the size of the Item Stack at the top of the stack to that number.

hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.title: Dousing Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.text: Works similar to [Archer's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast) but targets only liquids, piercing through all other blocks.

hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.title: Lilypad Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.text: Works similar to [Architect's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast/axis) but targets only liquids, piercing through all other blocks.

hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.title: Railgun Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.text: Works similar to [Archer's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast) but accepts an additional identifier. It will pierce all blocks until it hits the block specified by the identifier.

hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.title: Laser Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/special_raycasts#hex.text: Works similar to [Architect's Distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:raycast/axis) but accepts an additional identifier. It will pierce all blocks until it hits the block specified by the identifier.

hexcasting:patterns/grok#hexical:grok_pu.title: Grok Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/grok#hexical:grok_pu.text: Pushes two lists; one of the stack and one of the unfinished list building after an unclosed [Introspection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren). Entity references to players that are not me become [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences).

hexcasting:patterns/grok#hexical:grok_pu.title: Grok Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/grok#hexical:grok_pu.text: Takes two lists of iotas and sets them as my stack and my parenthesized list respectively. Entity references to players that are not me become [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences).

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:ind.title: Selection Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:ind.text: Remove the number at the top of the stack, then replace the list at the top with the nth element of that list (where n is the number you removed). Replaces the list with [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the number is out of bounds.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:sli.title: Selection Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:sli.text: Remove the two numbers at the top of the stack, then take a sublist of the list at the top of the stack between those indices, lower bound inclusive, upper bound exclusive. For example, the 0, 2 sublist of [0, 1, 2, 3, 4] would be [0, 1].

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:app.title: Integration Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:app.text: Remove the top of the stack, then add it to the end of the list at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:una.title: Derivation Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:una.text: Remove the iota on the end of the list at the top of the stack, and add it to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:add.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:add.text: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then add all its elements to the end of the list at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:emp.title: Vacant Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:emp.text: Push an empty list to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:sin.title: Single's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:sin.text: Remove the top of the stack, then push a list containing only that element.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:abs.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:abs.text: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then push the number of elements in the list to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rev.title: Retrograde Purification
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rev.text: Reverse the list at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:ind.title: Locator's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:ind.text: Remove the iota at the top of the stack, then replace the list at the top with the first index of that iota within the list (starting from 0). Replaces the list with -1 if the iota doesn't exist in the list.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rem.title: Excisor's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rem.text: Remove the number at the top of the stack, then remove the nth element of the list at the top of the stack (where n is the number you removed).

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rep.title: Surgeon's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:rep.text: Remove the top iota of the stack and the number at the top, then set the nth element of the list at the top of the stack to that iota (where n is the number you removed). Does nothing if the number is out of bounds.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:las.title: Flock's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:las.text: Remove *num* elements from the stack, then add them to a list at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:spl.title: Flock's Disintegration
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:spl.text: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then push its contents to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:con.title: Speaker's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:con.text: Remove the top iota, then add it as the first element to the list at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:dec.title: Speaker's Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/lists#hexcasting:dec.text: Remove the first iota from the list at the top of the stack, then push that iota to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ge.title: Telepathic Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ge.text: By focusing on a particular image, I can detect that concentration via this pattern. Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Call Telepathy, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:se.title: Send Thought
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:se.text: Momentarily displays an iota above my hotbar. If cast repeatedly, each cast overwrites the previous instantly.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sh.title: Shout Thought
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sh.text: Grandly flashes an iota across my vision. It obstructs my vision and takes some time to fade in, so I shall only use it sparingly.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:pl.title: Hallucinate Pling
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:pl.text: Causes me to hear a pling that is inaudible to others.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:cl.title: Hallucinate Click
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:cl.text: Causes me to hear a click that is inaudible to others.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:le.title: Offensive Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:le.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Attack/Destroy, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ri.title: Manipulative Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ri.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Use Item/Place Block, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.title: Charge Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Walk Forwards, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.title: Retreat Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Walk Backwards, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.title: Dodge Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Strafe Left, or -1 if I am not. Can be differentiated from Evade Reflection because d comes to the left of e.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.title: Evade Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:mo.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Strafe Right, or -1 if I am not. Can be differentiated from Dodge Reflection because e comes to the right of d.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ju.title: Leaping Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:ju.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Jump, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sn.title: Stealthy Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sn.text: Pushes how many twentieths of a second I've been intending to Sneak, or -1 if I am not.

hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sc.title: Rolling Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/telepathy#hexical:sc.text: Pushes the change in scrolling I have performed since I have invoked Telepathy.

hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.title: Consideration
hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.text: To use [Consideration](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:escape), I draw it, then another arbitrary pattern. That second pattern is added to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.title: Introspection
hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.text: Drawing [Introspection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren) makes my drawing of patterns act differently, for a time. Until I draw [Retrospection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren), the patterns I draw are saved. Then, when I draw [Retrospection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:close_paren), they are added to the stack as a list iota.

hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.title: Retrospection
hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.text: If I draw another [Introspection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:close_paren), it'll still be saved to the list, but I'll then have to draw *two* [Retrospections](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:close_paren) to get back to normal casting.

hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.title: Evanition
hexcasting:patterns/patterns_as_iotas#he.text: Finally, if I make a mistake while drawing patterns inside [Intro-](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren) and [Retrospection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:close_paren) I can draw [Evanition](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:undo) to remove the last pattern that I drew from the pattern list that is being constructed.

hexcasting:patterns/extradimensional_cas.title: Heimdall's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/extradimensional_cas.text: A strange pattern that appears to be a variant of Hermes' Gambit. Accepts a spatial imprint and an executable iota, and attempts to cast the iota in the corresponding dimension.

hexcasting:patterns/extradimensional_cas.title: Shift Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/extradimensional_cas.text: Accepts a spatial imprint, and moves my sentinel to its scaled coordinates in the corresponding dimension. Costs one amethyst shard. Mishaps if I do not currently have a sentinel.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Scribe's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Copy the iota stored in the item in my other hand and add it to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Scribe's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the item in my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Chronicler's Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Like [Scribe's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:read), but the iota is read out of an entity instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Chronicler's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text:
Like [Scribe's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:read), but the iota is written to an entity instead of my other hand.
Interestingly enough, it looks like I cannot write my own Name using this spell. I get a sense that I might be endangered if I could.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Auditor's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: If the item in my other hand holds an iota I can read, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Auditor's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Like [Auditor's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:readable), but the readability of an entity is checked instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Assessor's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: If I could save an iota into the item in my other hand, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Assessor's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Like [Assessor's Reflection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:writable), but the writability of an entity is checked instead of my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: The Ravenmind
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Items are not the only places I can store information, however. I am also able to store that information in the media of the Hex itself, much like the stack, but separate. Texts refer to this as the [ravenmind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:local). It holds a single iota, much like a [Focus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus), and begins with [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) like the same. It is preserved between iterations of [Thoth's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each), but only lasts as long as the Hex it's a part of. Once I stop casting, the value will be lost.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Huginn's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Removes the top iota from the stack, and saves it to my [ravenmind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:local), storing it there until I stop casting the Hex.

hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.title: Muninn's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/readwrite#hexcasting.text: Copy the iota out of my [ravenmind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:local), which I likely just wrote with [Huginn's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:write/local).

hexcasting:soroban#overevaluate:soroban_.title: Soroban Reflection
hexcasting:soroban#overevaluate:soroban_.text: Pushes soroban's current value and then increases it. Starts at 0.

hexcasting:soroban#overevaluate:soroban_.title: Soroban Gambit II
hexcasting:soroban#overevaluate:soroban_.text: Pops a number from the stack and sets the soroban to it.

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Sine Purification
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the sine of an angle in radians, yielding the vertical component of that angle drawn on a unit circle. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Cosine Purification
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the cosine of an angle in radians, yielding the horizontal component of that angle drawn on a unit circle. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Tangent Purification
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the tangent of an angle in radians, yielding the slope of that angle drawn on a circle. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Inverse Sine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the inverse sine of a value with absolute value 1 or less, yielding the angle whose sine is that value. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Inverse Cosine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the inverse cosine of a value with absolute value 1 or less, yielding the angle whose cosine is that value. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Inverse Tangent Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the inverse tangent of a value, yielding the angle whose tangent is that value. Related to the values of [π](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/pi) and [τ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/tau).

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Inverse Tan. Prfn. II
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Takes the inverse tangent of a Y and X value, yielding the angle between the X-axis and a line from the origin to that point.

hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.title: Logarithmic Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/advanced_math#hexcas.text: Removes the number at the top of the stack, then takes the logarithm of the number at the top using the other number as its base. Related to the value of [*e*](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/consts@hexcasting:const/double/e).

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Transformation Prfct.
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Converts the iota on top of the stack into a matrix. This iota can be a number, vector, or list.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Restoration Prfct.
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Converts the iota on top of the stack back from a matrix into a number, vector, or list depending on the vector's size.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Restoration Prfct. II
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: As [Restoration Purification](https://moreiotas.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/matrices@moreiotas:matrix/unmake), except it always returns a list of lists of numbers.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Identity Purification
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts a positive integer n, and returns an n by n matrix with 1 along the diagonal and 0 elsewhere.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Zero Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts positive integers n and m, and returns an n by m matrix of zeros.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Rotation Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts a vec v and number θ, and returns a matrix representing rotating by θ radians around v.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.text: Adds two matrices together; they must have the same number of columns and rows.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.title: Multiplicative Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.text: Multiplies the first n by m by with an m by p matrix to get an n by p matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.title: Division Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.text: Divides the first n by m matrix with an m by m matrix to get an n by m matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.title: Power Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.text: Accepts a square matrix and an integer, and raises the matrix to the power of the integer.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.title: Multiplicative Dstl. II
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.text: Multiplies the first n by m matrix elementwise with another n by m matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.title: Division Dstl. II
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.text: Divides the first n by m matrix elementwise by another n by m matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.title: Power Distillation II
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:a.text: Raises the first n by m matrix elementwise to the power of another n by m matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.title: Retrograde Purification
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#hexcasting:.text: Accepts an n by m matrix and returns an m by n matrix where every entry has been flipped along the diagonal.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Inverse Purification
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts an n by n matrix and returns the n by n matrix such that in\*out = identity.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Determinant Purification
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts a square matrix and returns the determinant of that matrix. Mishaps for matrices larger than 4x4.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Tower Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts an n by m matrix and a p by m matrix and produces a (n+p) by m matrix by putting the first matrix on top of the second.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Sprawling Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts an n by m matrix and an n by p matrix and produces an n by (m+p) matrix by putting the first matrix to the left of the second.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Toppling Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts an n by m matrix and an int from 0 to n, and returns two matrices created by splitting the input matrix vertically at the inputted int.

hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.title: Mitosis Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/matrices#moreiotas:m.text: Accepts an n by m matrix and an int from 0 to m, and returns two matrices created by splitting the input matrix horizontally at the inputted int.

hexcasting:patterns/misc#complexhex:asci.title: UTF Purification
hexcasting:patterns/misc#complexhex:asci.text:
Swaps between a string of a *single character* and an integer representing that character.
Uses the UTF-16 character map.

hexcasting:patterns/hotbar_loci_patterns.title: Set Slot
hexcasting:patterns/hotbar_loci_patterns.text: This takes a number between 0 and 5 (inclusive), and sets the held slot of the bound [Pocket Simulator](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/hotbar_loci). Free.

hexcasting:patterns/hotbar_loci_patterns.title: List Items
hexcasting:patterns/hotbar_loci_patterns.text: This returns all the items held within the [Pocket Simulator](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/hotbar_loci) as [Item Stack Iotas](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/scrying/item). Free.

hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:and.title: Conjunction Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:and.text: Takes the intersection of two sets.

hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:xor.title: Exclusion Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:xor.text: Takes the exclusive disjunction of two sets.

hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:not.title: Negation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:not.text: Takes the inversion of a bitset, changing all "on" bits to "off" and vice versa. In my experience, this will take the form of that number negated and decreased by one. For example, 0 will become -1, and -100 will become 99.

hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:uniq.title: Uniqueness Purification
hexcasting:patterns/sets#hexcasting:uniq.text: Removes duplicate entries from a list.

hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.title: Wave Location Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.text: Adds the current position of the Media Wave to the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.title: Wave Facing Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.text: Adds the current facing of the Media Wave to the top of the stack. If the current block does not have a facing, it returns a vector of [0,0,0].

hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.title: Wave Speed Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.text: Adds the current speed of the Media Wave to the top of the stack. This is measured in how many 20ths of a second the Media Wave waits until going to the next [Slate.](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/slate)

hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.title: Circle Media Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/slate_reflections#sl.text: Adds the current amount of Media in the Impetus to the stack, in units of [dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.title: Athena's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.text: Casts a list of patterns similar to [Hermes' Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:eval) but allows for handling of mishaps.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.title: Athena's Revelation
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.text: Reveals to me the last mishap caught by [Athena's Gambit](https://miyucomics.github.io/overevaluate/v/latest/main/en_us#metaevals@overevaluate:athena) within this Hex.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.title: Athena's Reflection
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:athena.text: Pushes the last mishap caught by [Athena's Gambit](https://miyucomics.github.io/overevaluate/v/latest/main/en_us#metaevals@overevaluate:athena) as *text* if the appropriate powers are active in this world.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:apep.title: Apep's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:apep.text: Folds across the first list using the Hex in the second list.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:janus.title: Janus' Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:janus.text: Instantly terminates the Hex regardless of current circumstances.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:maat.title: Ma'at's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:maat.text: Takes a boolean and any iota. If the boolean is false, mishaps and prints the iota.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:nephth.title: Nephthys' Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:nephth.text: Pops a pattern or pattern list and dives down an amount corresponding to the tail length to cast the pattern list. Useful for surgery-like operations.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:atalan.title: Atalanta's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:atalan.text: Should only be run inside [Thoth's](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each) or [Sisyphus' Gambit](https://miyucomics.github.io/overevaluate/v/latest/main/en_us#metaevals@overevaluate:sisyphus). Acts similarly to [Charon's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:halt) except does not end the iterator, only skips the rest of the current iteration.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:castor.title: Castor's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:castor.text: Should only be run within a [Thoth's](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each). Details on the next page. Beware of triggering the Delve Too Deep mishap.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:pollux.title: Pollux's Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:pollux.text: Sibling pattern to [Castor's Gambit](https://miyucomics.github.io/overevaluate/v/latest/main/en_us#metaevals@overevaluate:castor), this pattern schedules the additional iteration for the end instead. Carries the same risk of encountering the Delve Too Deep mishap.

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:sisyph.title: Sisyphus' Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:sisyph.text: Takes a pattern list and casts it over and over forever until it encounters either a [Charon's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:halt) or a [Janus' Gambit](https://miyucomics.github.io/overevaluate/v/latest/main/en_us#metaevals@overevaluate:janus).

hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:themis.title: Themis' Gambit
hexcasting:metaevals#overevaluate:themis.text: Takes a list and a pattern or pattern list which is used to sort the list by casting over every iota similar to [Thoth's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:for_each).

hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:eval.title: Hermes' Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:eval.text: Remove a pattern or list of patterns from the stack, then cast them as if I had drawn them myself with my [Staff](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff) (until a [Charon's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:halt) is encountered). If an iota is escaped with [Consideration](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:escape) or [its ilk](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren), it will be pushed to the stack. Otherwise, non-patterns will fail.

hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:eval.title: Iris' Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:eval.text: Cast a pattern or list of patterns from the stack exactly like [Hermes' Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:eval), except that a unique "Jump" iota is pushed to the stack beforehand.

hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:for_.title: Thoth's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:for_.text: Remove a list of patterns and a list from the stack, then cast the given pattern over each element of the second list.

hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:halt.title: Charon's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:halt.text: This pattern forcibly halts a Hex. This is mostly useless on its own, as I could simply just stop writing patterns, or put down my staff.

hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:than.title: Thanatos' Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/meta#hexcasting:than.text: Adds the number of patterns a Hex is still capable of evaluating to the stack. This is reduced by one for each pattern cast by the Hex.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:a.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:a.text: Removes the top two strings from the stack and combines them together.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Separation Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Removes the top two strings from the stack and splits the first string, using the second string as the delimiter and returning as a list.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Input Purification
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Removes a string from the top of the stack and returns the number that string parses as (or null if it doesn't parse).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:i.title: Locator's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:i.text: Removes two strings from the top of the stack, and returns the first index of the first string where the second string is a substring.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:s.title: Selection Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:s.text: Removes a string and two positive integers from the top of the stack, and returns the substring from the first to the second (inclusive first, exclusive second).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:a.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/strings#hexcasting:a.text: Removes a string and returns its length.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Blank Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Add an empty string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Spacing Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Add a blank space string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Comma Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Add a comma string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Breaking Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Add a string to the stack representing a break between lines, useful for combining with other strings.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Whisper Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Adds the last message the caster sent to the stack as a string.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Listener's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Adds the last message anyone sent to the stack as a string.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Sifter's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Accepts a string; All future chat messages starting with that string won't be seen by others, and only messages prefixed with that string can be read by [Whisper Reflection](https://moreiotas.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/strings@moreiotas:string/chat/caster).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Sifter's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Returns the last string you passed to [Sifter's Gambit](https://moreiotas.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/strings@moreiotas:string/chat/prefix/set).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Reader's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Removes a vector from the stack. If that vector is pointing at a sign or lectern, it returns that sign or lectern's text to the stack. Otherwise, it returns null.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Write
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Removes a vector and a string from the stack. If that vector is pointing at a sign or lectern, it writes that string to that sign or lectern. Costs a hundredth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Scrivener's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Converts the iota on top of the stack into a string.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Patternmaster's Prfct.
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Converts the pattern on top of the stack into the string for that pattern's name. If there is no action associated with that pattern, or if the associated pattern is a Great Spell, it returns null.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Moniker Purification
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Takes an entity and returns that entity's name. If it is an item entity, return the item's name.

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Name
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Takes a string and an entity, and sets that entities name to the given string. If the entity is an item entity, also set the item's name. Costs a hundredth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.title: Case Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/strings#moreiotas:st.text: Removes a string and a bool or null. If it was true, return the string in upper case. If false, lowercase. If null, toggle each character's case.

hexcasting:patterns/akashic_conveniences.title: Librarian's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/akashic_conveniences.text: Reads the pattern key of an [Akashic Bookshelf](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib).

hexcasting:patterns/akashic_conveniences.title: Librarian's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/akashic_conveniences.text: Writes an iota under a pattern key to an [Akashic Bookshelf](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib).

hexcasting:patterns/bubble#complexhex:bu.title: Bubbles' Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bubble#complexhex:bu.text: Pushes a Bubbled Iota, which when popped via execution (by Hermes' or the likes), will push the contained iota to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/delimcc#caduceus:eva.title: Thetis' Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/delimcc#caduceus:eva.text: Cast a pattern or list of patterns from the stack exactly like [Hermes' Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:eval), except that anything outside of this cast will not be captured by an [Arke's Gambit](https://caduceus.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1+1.20.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/delimcc@caduceus:eval/control) within it.

hexcasting:patterns/delimcc#caduceus:eva.title: Arke's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/delimcc#caduceus:eva.text: Cast a pattern or list of patterns from the stack similarly to [Iris' Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/meta@hexcasting:eval/cc). Must be drawn within [Thetis' Gambit](https://caduceus.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1+1.20.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/delimcc@caduceus:eval/prompt).

hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_pe#hextwea.title: Wave Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_pe#hextwea.text: Returns the posistion of the Wave of media passing through a [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus)

hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_pe#hextwea.title: Normals reflection
hexcasting:patterns/hextweaks_pe#hextwea.text: Returns the normal of the slate the Wave is on in the [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus)

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.text: Remove the Jump iota at the top of the stack, then add all its frames to the bottom of the Jump iota at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.text: Remove the Jump iota at the top of the stack, then push the number of frames within it to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.title: Flock's Disintegration
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.text: Remove the Jump iota at the top of the stack, then, for each of its frames, push a new Jump iota containing only that frame to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.title: Speaker's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.text: Remove the Jump iota at the top of the stack, then add its top frame to the top of the Jump iota at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.title: Speaker's Decomposition
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#he.text: Remove the top frame from the Jump iota at the top of the stack, then push a new Jump iota containing only that frame to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ju.title: Jump Tags
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ju.text:
The [ravenmind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:local) is not the only place that I can store information within a Hex. In fact, I am able to hide iotas within the very concept of evaluation. I call this technique jump tags; some other texts refer to it as "continuation marks".
There is one notable limitation of jump tags, however: they can only hold a single iota at a time. Unlike the [ravenmind](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:local), even lists are too much.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.title: Ewer's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.text: Copy the iota stored in the jump tag of the current evaluation and add it to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.title: Ewer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.text: Like [Ewer's Reflection](https://caduceus.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1+1.20.1/1.0/en_us#patterns/jump_manipulation@caduceus:read/mark/local), but the iota is read out of the jump tag of the top frame in a Jump iota.

hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.title: Ewer's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/jump_manipulation#ca.text:
Remove the top iota from the stack, and write it to the jump tag of the current evaluation.
As with [Chronicler's Gambit](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/readwrite@hexcasting:write/entity), I cannot write my own Name using this spell.

hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.title: Waystone Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.text: Returns the position of the [Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) of this spell circle.

hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.title: Lodestone Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.text: Returns the direction the [Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) of this spell circle is facing as a unit vector.

hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.title: Lesser Fold Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.text: Returns the position of the lower-north-west corner of the bounds of this spell circle.

hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.title: Greater Fold Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/circle#hexcasting:ci.text: Returns the position of the upper-south-east corner of the bounds of this spell circle.

hexcasting:patterns/akashic_patterns#hex.title: Akasha's Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/akashic_patterns#hex.text: Read the iota associated with the given pattern out of the [Akashic Library](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib) with its [Record](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib) at the given position. This has no range limit. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/akashic_patterns#hex.title: Akasha's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/akashic_patterns#hex.text: Associate the iota with the given pattern in the [Akashic Library](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib) with its [Record](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib) at the given position. This *does* have a range limit. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.title: Inscribe Idea
hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.text: Accepts a valid key and any iota, and stores it in the corresponding location. Costs a quarter of an amethyst dust.

hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.title: Retrieve Idea
hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.text: Accepts a valid key, and returns the corresponding iota. Costs one-eigth of an amethyst dust.

hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.title: Metadata Purification
hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.text: Accepts a valid key, and returns when the corresponding iota was inscribed, or -1. Costs no media.

hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.title: Metadata Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/idea_inscription#one.text: Accepts a valid key and a player, and returns whether the corresponding iota was inscribed by that player. Costs no media.

hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.title: Mnemosyne's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.text: Takes the position of an [Akashic Record](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib), as well as a Pattern as a key, and retrieves the iota at that key from your Everbook, storing it in the given [Akashic Record](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib) if able.

hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.title: Elysium's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.text: Takes the position of an [Akashic Record](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib), as well as a Pattern as a key, and stores the iota in that record at that key to your Everbook at the same key.

hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.title: Lethe's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.text: Takes a pattern and removes the entry with that pattern key from your Everbook.

hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.title: Brigh's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/everbook#hexal:everb.text: Takes a pattern and marks that entry of your Everbook as a Pattern that when drawn by your hand will be treated as any other of Nature's patterns.

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Oncologist's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gives the bust size of the target

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Oncologist's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the bust size of the caster

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Gainax Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gives the bounciness of the target's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Gainax Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the bounciness of the caster's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Lindhal's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gives the floppiness of the target's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Lindhal's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the floppiness of the caster's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Hookean Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gives the physics of the target's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Hookean Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the physics of the caster's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Cleavage Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gets the cleavage of the target's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Cleavage Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the cleavage of the caster's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Liposuction Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gets the offset of the target's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Liposuction Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets the offset of the caster's breasts

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Symmastia Purification
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Gets whether the target's breasts are a uniboob

hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.title: Symmastia Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/bust_patterns#hexgen.text: Sets whether the caster's breasts are a uniboob

hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.title: Jason's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.text: Turns the given String into a JSON object. If it cannot be parsed into a JSON object itself, a wrapper JSON object will be created.

hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.title: Jason's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.text: Checks whether the given JSON iota has the given key.

hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.title: Jason's Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.text: Gets the stored iota at the given key. Mishaps upon their being no iota.

hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.title: Jason's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/json_patterns#hexweb.text: Sets the given iota at the given key. Setting a Garbage iota removes the key.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:enqueue.title: Enqueue
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:enqueue.text: Enqueues a Hex to cast after that many twentieths of a second. It takes an iota to use as the label for the cassette.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:dequeue.title: Dequeue
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:dequeue.text: I can also automate killing cassettes with this pattern. It takes an iota and dequeues the cassette with that label if it exists.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:killall.title: Disqueue
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:killall.text: Terminates all cassettes, similar to the effects of the Parallel Processing mishap.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:specs.title: Threading Reflection
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:specs.text: Pushes the total number of cassettes slots that I currently have.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:free.title: Threading Reflection II
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:free.text: Pushes the number of non-busy cassette slots that I currently have.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:inspect.title: Program Purification
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:inspect.text: Pushes null if I do not have an active cassette with that label, or the cassette's Hex if I do. I hear rumors of this being used for iota storage and passing information between Hexes.

hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:foretell.title: Program Purification II
hexcasting:async#hexcassettes:foretell.text: Pushes null if I do not have an active cassette with that label, or how many twentieths of a second until that cassette fires if I do.

hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:create.title: Schrödinger's Refl.
hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:create.text: Creates a property iota for a random Property. Costs about five [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) to etch this law into the universe.

hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:observ.title: Observation Purif.
hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:observ.text: Observes the current value of the property iota.

hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:set_pr.title: Schrödinger's Gambit
hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:set_pr.text: Sets the property iota. Costs about a tenth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:readon.title: Schrödinger's Purif.
hexcasting:properties#hexcellular:readon.text: Creates a read-only property iota that refers to the same Property as the given property iota.

hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.title: Mirror Prfn. Z
hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.text: Flips a stored Structure front-to-back, or across the Z-axis.

hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.title: Mirror Prfn. X
hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.text: Flips a stored Structure left-to-right, or across the X-axis.

hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.title: Bounding Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.text: Removes a Structure from the stack, returning its dimensions in the format [x, y, z].

hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.title: Transformation Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/structures#hexstruct.text:
Removes a Structure from the stack, returning its transformations as a list in the format [mirror, rotation].
No Mirror -> 0; Front-Back -> 1; Left-Right -> 2
No Rotation -> 0; 90 CW -> 1; 180 CW -> 2; 90 CCW -> 3

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Hierophant's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Pushes a list of iotas representing all my embedded minds.

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Stabilize Minds
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: When I die, my embedded minds become unstable and cease to function. This spell restores them to working order. Costs one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per mind restored.

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Payload Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Stores the provided Hex into the mind. If there is already a stored Hex, it will be overwritten. Costs one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Payload Purification
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Pushes the Hex stored in the provided mind, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one.

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Trigger Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Stores the provided trigger into the mind. If the mind already has a trigger, it will be overwritten. Costs one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Trigger Purification
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Pushes the trigger stored in the provided mind, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one.

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Mute Mind
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text: Suppresses sound and particles from the provided mind's casting, based on the state of the bool. If true, the mind will be muted; if false, it will be unmuted.

hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.title: Free Mind
hexcasting:patterns/mind_handling#hierop.text:
Permanently removes an embedded mind from my own consciousness.
I wonder what happens to them, when they go?

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Damage
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I take damage. To prevent a lethal chain-reaction, does not activate if the damage was caused by overcasting.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: DmgType
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I take damage, but only if the damage was of a specific type. The trigger will be attuned to whatever type of damage I last received.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Prfn: Health
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates when my health drops below the specified value. A full, standard healthbar has a value of 20.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Prfn: Breath
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates when my breath drops below the specified value. A full bar of bubbles has a value of 10.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Prfn: Hunger
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates when my hunger drops below the specified value. A full hunger bar has a value of 20.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Prfn: Velocity
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates when my velocity (measured in blocks per tick) exceeds the specified value.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Prfn: Fall
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates when I fall further than the specified number of blocks.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Drop
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I drop an item. This does **not** include involuntary dropping, such as on death or when using [Greater Teleport](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/teleport).

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Attack
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I strike another entity.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Break
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I break a block.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Jump
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I jump.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Trigger Rfln: Teleport
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Creates a trigger that activates whenever I teleport. For reasons I cannot discern, this will not detect teleports shorter than 1.5 blocks in length.

hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.title: Inversion Purification
hexcasting:patterns/triggers#hierophanti.text: Inverts the threshold on a numerical trigger. For example, 'When velocity exceeds 5.0' will become 'When velocity drops below 5.0'. Has no effect on other types of triggers.

hexcasting:patterns/tree_patterns#dthexc.title: Arborist Purification
hexcasting:patterns/tree_patterns#dthexc.text: Provided a tree's position, I can extract the Species of the tree.

hexcasting:patterns/tree_patterns#dthexc.title: Arborist Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/tree_patterns#dthexc.text: Provided a tree's position, I can extract the structure of the tree as a Base64 string.

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Circle Marker Exlt.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Creates a new Circle Marker with the provided identifier, label, position, and radius

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Rectangle Marker Exlt.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Creates a new Rectangle Marker with the provided identifier, label, top corner, and bottom corner

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Polygon Marker Exlt.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Creates a new Polygon Marker with the provided identifier, label, and list of positions OR a Hexical Mesh Entity

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Polyline Marker Exlt.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Creates a new Polyline Marker with the provided identifier, label, and list of positions OR a Hexical Mesh Entity

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Icon Marker Exlt.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Creates a new Icon Marker with the provided identifier, label, icon, and position

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Marker Fill Dist.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Sets the Fill Color of a marker, if applicable (Circle, Rectangle, and Polygon)

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Marker Line Dist.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Sets the Line Color of a marker, if applicable (Circle, Rectangle, Polyline, and Polygon)

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Marker Line Dist. II
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Sets the Line Weight of a marker, if applicable (Circle, Rectangle, Polyline, and Polygon)

hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.title: Marker Dist.
hexcasting:patterns/marker_actions#hexma.text: Checks if a marker exists on the map under the provided identifier

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Miner's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes how difficult blocks of this type are to mine.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Demoman's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes how resistant blocks of this type are to explosions.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Orientation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes the vector of the block's facing direction, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if blocks of its type do not have an orientation.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Farmer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes a number 0 to 1 corresponding to the growth progress of that block. Works for crops, Beehives, Composters, Cauldrons, and strangely Cakes too.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Facet Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes a list of all facets of that block.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Facet Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Takes a block and a facet and pushes that facet's value.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.title: Cartographer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/blocks#hexpo.text: Pushes the color blocks of this type appear as on a map.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/chat#hexpose.title: News Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/chat#hexpose.text: Pushes a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) of the last person to use chat, a [text iota](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) of the message, and a number of twenieths of a second since that message sent.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/chat#hexpose.title: Newspaper Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/chat#hexpose.text: Applies [News Reflection](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/scrying/chat@hexpose:get_message) to the last up to 32 messages in chat, wraps each in a list, and pushes a list of those lists.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Caliper's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Similar to [Stadiometer's Purification](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:get_entity_height) but pushes the width of an entity rather than its height.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Theodolite Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Similar to [Alidade's Purification](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/basics@hexcasting:get_entity_look) but pushes the vector that points upwards from their head rather than the entity's facing vector.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Vitality Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes how close an entity is to death. I can think of these in terms of half-hearts.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Fitness Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes how much health an entity can have at its prime. I can think of these in terms of half-hearts.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Suffocation Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the number of seconds before an entity will start to suffocate. This applies to marine creatures out of water as well as land creatures in water.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Lung Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the number of seconds a regular entity of that type can last outside their normal breathing environment before they start suffocating.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Inferno Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the number of seconds the burning entity will continue burning if not put out. -1 if the entity is not burning currently.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Enderman's Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes whether the entity is touching rain, water, or in a bubble column.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Youth Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes whether a living creature is a baby. Also works on Armor Stands oddly.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Reproduction Purif.
