hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes whether an animal creature is in love and ready to mate, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if that creature is not capable of that type of reproduction.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Sloth's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes whether the Player, Cat, Fox, or other entity is sleeping.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Racer's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes whether the Player, Cat, Fox, or other entity is sprinting. Swimming and leaving the ground after starting to sprint are still included.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Vehicle Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the entity the given entity is riding or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it is not riding in or on anything.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Jockey Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes a list of entities that are riding the given entity.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Shooter Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the shooter of the given projectile entity or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it has no shooter or isn't a projectile. It also pushes [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the shooter is outside my ambit.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Adoration Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the player that has tamed this animal, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it is untamed or the player is out of ambit.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.title: Absorption Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/entities#hex.text: Pushes the number of magical hearts this player has. I can think of these in terms of half-hearts.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.title: Ambit Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.text: Pushes whether a location or entity is in ambit.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.title: Staff Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.text: Pushes whether a [Staff](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff) is being used to cast this pattern.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.title: Dexterity Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.text: Pushes whether the dominant hand of the caster is being used to cast this pattern. May return strange results for casters without hands.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.title: Device Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.text: Pushes whether any form of [casting device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting) is being used to cast this pattern.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.title: Constructed Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/environment#.text: Pushes whether some form of [*grand work*](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) is being used to cast this pattern.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Hunger Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Pushes how full a Player is. I can think of this in terms of half-hunches.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Stamina Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Pushes a Player's saturation, which roughly correlates to how long the Player will remain full.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Edibility Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether I can eat it.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Calorie Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Takes in an item identifier and pushes the amount it will fill me.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Satiation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Takes in an item identifier and pushes the saturation value, which roughly affects how long it will fill me.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Flesh Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether it's considered a meat. Wolves can eat meats.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.title: Dessert Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/food#hexpose.text: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether it's a snack.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/identifiers#.title: Detective's Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/identifiers#.text: Pushes the identifier of an entity or block at a vector.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/identifiers#.title: Modicum Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/identifiers#.text: Pushes the identifier of an iota's type. Can be used to determine whether two iota are the same type.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Item Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Pushes the item that an Item in the world is.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Offer Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Creates an item iota from an item identifier and the number of items in the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Tool Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns the item in the entity's mainhand.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Accessory Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns the item in the entity's offhand.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Cart Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns a list of all items the entity is carrying, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the entity can not hold items. Trying to access another Player's inventory will incur a mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Chest Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns a list of all items in the container, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the block can not contain items.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Aegis Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns a list of all items the entity is wearing, from feet up.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Pocket Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Returns a list of all items in my ender chest.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Storage Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Takes in an item and pushes how many items are in it.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Warehouse Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Takes in an item and pushes how many items that can stack in it.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Deterioration Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Takes in an item and pushes how much damage the item has sustained.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Fragility Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Takes in an item and pushes how much durability the item can have at its peak.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Thaumaturgist's Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Gets a list of enchantments the item has.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Charm Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Gets the strength of the specific enchantment on the item.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Appellation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Gets the name given to this item.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Legacy Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Gets the lore written into this item.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Glamour Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: If this item is subceptible to [Caster's Glamour](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/cyclevariant), pushes the index of the current form it's taking on. Otherwise pushes [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences).

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Glamour Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: If this item is subceptible to [Caster's Glamour](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/cyclevariant), pushes the number of forms it's capable of. Otherwise pushes [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences).

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Reading Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Pushes a list of [text iotas](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/text_iotas) contained inside a book or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it isn't a book.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Bibliography Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Pushes the author of a book and its generation number.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.title: Collector Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/item#hexpose.text: Gauges the rarity of an item as a number, with greater values corresponding to a rarer item. Certain aspects such as enchantments can also elevate an item's rarity.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.title: Media Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.text: Pushes the media available to the current cast.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.title: Media Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.text: Pushes the amount of media inside an item, that a creature contains or holds, or that a specialized media-holding block contains.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.title: Potential Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/media#hexpos.text: Takes in an item and pushes either [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the item does not have any media-holding potential, or the amount of media it is capable of holding at its peak.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.title: Feline Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.text: Pushes the variant of the Cat.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.title: Anger Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.text: Pushes the progress of a Creeper to explosion.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.title: Showcase Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.text: Pushes the rotation of an Item Frame as an integer 0 to 7.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.title: Artistic Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/misc#hexpose.text: Pushes the variant of the Painting.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.title: Diagnosis Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.text: Pushes a list of status effects the entity is afflicted with.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.title: Prescription Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.text: Pushes a list of status effects the food or potion will bestow.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.title: Condition Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.text: Pushes the general "goodness" of the effect towards the afflicted. -1 for harmful, 0 for neutral, and 1 for beneficial.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.title: Concentration Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.text: Pushes how potent the effect type is acting on the entity or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the entity doesn't have it.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.title: Clearance Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/status_effec.text: Pushes how long the effect type will affect the entity in twentieths of a second or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the entity doesn't have it.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.title: Tier Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.text: Pushes how advanced a villager is as a number, encoding mastery of their craft.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.title: Professional Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.text: Pushes the profession of a villager as an identifier

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.title: Culture Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.text: Pushes the ambient cultural aspect tied to the villager’s origin, such as desert or taiga roots.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.title: Nurture Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/villager#hex.text: Projects the villager archetype most attuned to the essence of the specified biome, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if none can be drawn.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Luminance Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the light level at the position as a number 0 to 15. If inside a nontransparent block, it returns zero.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Meterologist's Refl.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes a number corresponding to the weather. 0 for clear, 1 for rain, and 2 for thundering.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Battery Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the Redstone power that a position receives.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Peripheral Purification
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the power level a Comparator would output if pressed against a position.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Circadian Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the progress of the day as a number between 0 (start) and 1 (end) of the day.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Temporal Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the twentieths of a second since the creation of the world, unaffected by events such as sleeping.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Geographical Purif.
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the identifier of the type of biome the vector is within.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Plane Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the identifier of the dimension the Hex is being cast in.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Lunar Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes the current phase of the Moon as a fraction of its size.

hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.title: Distortion Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/scrying/world#hexpos.text: Pushes whether Compasses and Clocks will work in this dimension.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Symbolic Purification
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Creates a new symbol with the given (single character) label

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Substitution Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Substitutes the third expression/number in place of the second expression within the first.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Equality Purification
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Creates an expression that equals 1 if the two expressions are equal, and 0 otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Piecewise Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Creates a piecewise expression that simplifies to the second argument if the first simplifies to 1.0, otherwise simplifies to the third argument.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Derivation Purification
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Takes in an expression and a lone symbol and returns the partial derivative of the expression with respect to the symbol.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Neo's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Takes in a width, height and expression and creates a matrix by substituting i & j-values into the expression corresponding to a position in the matrix and putting the result in the matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Parametric Line
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Summons a parametric line at the given position. The expression given will have a t-value (0-1), x/y/z position, and time (w) substituted in and must resolve to a vector on the line.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.title: Parametric Surface
hexcasting:patterns/maths/expressions#co.text: Summons a parametric surface at the given position. The expression given will have a u&v-value (0-1), x/y/z position, and time (w) substituted in and must resolve to a vector on the surface

hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#h.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#h.text: Performs Addition, num will be treated as num + 0i.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#h.title: Subtractive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#h.text: Performs Subtraction, num will be treated as num + 0i.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#c.title: Conjugation Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/complexities#c.text: Negates the imaginary coefficient of the topmost iota

hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.title: Long Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.text:
Just like with normal numbers, Nature is not so generous as to make this easy for us.
(Details on next page)

hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.title: Long Purification
hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.text:
Converts between [doubles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/numbers) and longs
Always truncates the value when converting to long

hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.title: Left Shift Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.text: Shifts all the bits to the left num times

hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.title: Logical Right Shift Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.text: Shifts all the bits to the right num times

hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.title: Arithmetic R. Shift Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/longs#complexh.text: Shifts all the bits to the right num times while preserving the sign

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Quaternionic Exal.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Pushes a Quaternion with num as the real coefficient and the vector's x, y, & z as the coefficients of i, j & k respectively.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Quaternionic Dntg.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Pushes the real coefficient and a vector where the x, y, & z components are the coefficients of i, j, & k respectively.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Multiplicative Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Performs Multiplication, Scalar if a num & quat are given, Hamiltonian if 2 quaternions are given.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Quaternionic Inverse
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Negates the coefficients of i, j, & k

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Matrixification
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Pushes a matrix that (should) represent the same rotation as the quaternion

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Quaterniation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Pushes a quaternion that (should) reperesent the same rotation as the matrix

hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.title: Axis Angle Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/maths/quaternionics#.text: Pushes a quaternion that reperesents a rotation by the given angle num radias around the given vector.

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Hyp. Sine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Hyp. Cosine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Hyp. Tangent Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Inv. Hyp. Sine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Inv. Hyp. Cosine Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.title: Inv. Hyp. Tangent Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/maths/horrors#comple.text: Evaluates the hyperbolic sine of the argument

hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.title: Explosion
hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.text: Remove a number and vector from the stack, then create an explosion at the given location with the given power.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.title: Fireball
hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.text: Remove a number and vector from the stack, then create a fiery explosion at the given location with the given power.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.title: Impulse
hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.text:
Remove an entity and direction from the stack, then give a shove to the given entity in the given direction. The strength of the impulse is determined by the length of the vector.
Costs units of [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) equal to the square of the length of the vector, plus one for every Impulse except the first targeting an entity.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.title: Blink
hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.text:
Remove an entity and length from the stack, then teleport the given entity along its look vector by the given length.
Costs about one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per two blocks travelled.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.title: Make Note
hexcasting:patterns/spells/basic#hexcast.text: Remove a vector and two numbers from the stack. Plays an instrument defined by the first number at the given location, with a note defined by the second number. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:estrogen#hextrogen:dash.title: Dash
hexcasting:estrogen#hextrogen:dash.text: Compels my mind to Dash according to the normalized vector. Cancels my velocity if given the zero vector. Free. If I am out of Dashes, does nothing. Requires Estrogen.

hexcasting:estrogen#hextrogen:refresh_da.title: Overdrive
hexcasting:estrogen#hextrogen:refresh_da.text: Instantly replenishes all of the player's Dashes. Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Nature *really* doesn't want me to dash infinitely, it seems. Requires Estrogen.

hexcasting:lesserteleport#lessertp:lesse.title: Lesser Teleport
hexcasting:lesserteleport#lessertp:lesse.text: Pass in an entity within ambit and a vec, and the entity's fractional position will change to the vector (clamped). A number means a vec with all the components set to it. Negligible cost, but disappointing.

hexcasting:simplerteleport#lessertp:simp.title: Simpler Teleport
hexcasting:simplerteleport#lessertp:simp.text: Takes an entity that will be within my ambit before and after teleportation and an offset vector, the length of which must be no greater than 10. Teleports the entity in that direction. Costs one shard.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Place Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text:
Remove a location from the stack, then pick a block item and place it at the given location.
Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Break Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text:
Remove a location from the stack, then break the block at the given location. This spell can break nearly anything a Diamond Pickaxe can break.
Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust, or a negligible amount if breaking a ](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)[](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/blockworks@hexcasting:conjure_block)[Conjured Block](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/blockworks@hexcasting:conjure_block) or [Conjured Light](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/blockworks@hexcasting:conjure_light).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Create Water
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Summon a block of water (or insert up to a bucket's worth) into a block at the given position. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Destroy Liquid
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Drains either a liquid container at, or a body of liquid around, the given position. Costs about two [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Conjure Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Conjure an ethereal, but solid, block that sparkles with my pigment at the given position. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Conjure Light
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Conjure a magical light that softly glows with my pigment at the given position. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Overgrow
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Encourage a plant or sapling at the target position to grow, as if Bonemeal was applied. Costs a bit more than one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Edify Sapling
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Forcibly infuse media into the sapling at the target position, causing it to grow into an [Edified Tree](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/edified). Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Ignite
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Start a fire on top of the given location, as if a Fire Charge was applied, or sets fire to a creature. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.title: Extinguish Area
hexcasting:patterns/spells/blockworks#he.text: Extinguish blocks in a large area. Costs about six [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Conjure Mage Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text:
Conjures a Mage Blocks at the location. Costs about three [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).
*I can create a city out of nothing, or I can cover it in volcanic rock.*

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Reset Mage Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text:
Conjures a Mage Blocks at the location. Costs about three [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).
*I can create a city out of nothing, or I can cover it in volcanic rock.*

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Bouncy
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text: Makes the block bouncy, like a Slime Block. Bounces me regardless of whether I am sneaking. Delightfully fun!

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Energized
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text: Sets the Redstone power outputted by this Mage Block.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Ephemeral
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text: Sets the duration after which a Mage Block will spontaneously disappear.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.title: Volatile
hexcasting:patterns/spells/mage_blocks#h.text: Breaking volatile Mage Blocks shatters others it is touching. This can cascade until every connected volatile block shatters.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/rotation#hexi.title: Rotate Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/rotation#hexi.text: Rotates a block to face a certain vector direction. Requires a rotatable block. Costs about an eighth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/rotation#hexi.title: Rotate Entity
hexcasting:patterns/spells/rotation#hexi.text: Rotates an entity by a given change in pitch and yaw, expressed in radians.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.title: Autograph
hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.text: Autographs the item in my offhand with my name and [Pigment](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/pigments). Autographing an item with my name already on it moves my name to the top of the list.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.title: Unautograph
hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.text: A more destructive form of [Erase Item](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/hexcasting@hexcasting:erase), capable of burning off autographs. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) similar to [Erase Item](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/hexcasting@hexcasting:erase).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.title: Authenticator's Dstl.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/autographs#he.text: Pushes whether a given player has signed a given item stack.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.title: Chromatic Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.text: Gets the dye of a block, entity, or block/item identifier.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.title: Dye
hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.text: Dyes a dyeable block or entity. Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.title: Vision Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/dyes#hexical:.text: Translates a dye color into a vector, where each component is from 0 to 1 and represents the red, green, and blueness of the dye respectively.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/magic_missile.title: Magic Missile
hexcasting:patterns/spells/magic_missile.text: Conjures a small silver of amethyst that always deals a full heart of damage and forces the target backwards. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.title: White Sun's Nadir
hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.text: Inflicts weakness. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 10 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.title: Blue Sun's Nadir
hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.text: Inflicts levitation. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 5 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.title: Black Sun's Nadir
hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.text: Inflicts withering. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per second.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.title: Red Sun's Nadir
hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.text: Inflicts poison. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 3 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.title: Green Sun's Nadir
hexcasting:patterns/spells/nadirs#hexcas.text: Inflicts slowness. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 5 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/pigments#hexi.title: Pigment Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/pigments#hexi.text: Takes a colored dye iota and transforms it into a pigment, takes a player and returns their pigment, or takes an item containing a pigment and returns its pigment.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/pigments#hexi.title: Pigment Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/spells/pigments#hexi.text: Samples the pigment at a certain place and time as a vector, where each component is from 0 to 1 and represents the red, green, and blueness respectively.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/prestidigitat.title: Prestidigitation
hexcasting:patterns/spells/prestidigitat.text: Causes a small magical effect, not too distinct from the original nature or function of the target. Costs about a tenth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.title: Wristpocket
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.text: This spell vanishes the stack of items in my other hand, or conjures it back, swapping if my other hand is holding something. Costs about a eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.title: Wristpocket Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.text: Returns the item in my wristpocket, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it is empty.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.title: Sleight
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.text: Performs an act of magical sleight of hand to steal items into my wristpocket or expel my wristpocket back into the world. Costs about a fourth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.title: Mage Hand
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.text: Projects my mind's hand forward to use my wristpocketed item and interact with the world. If my wristpocket is empty, acts as though a plain hand had reached out. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.title: Mage Mouth
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wristpocket#h.text: Makes me eat my wristpocketed item, nourishing me or applying potions to me. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) and mishaps if the item is not edible.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexcasting#he.title: Recharge Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexcasting#he.text: Recharge a media-containing item in my other hand. Costs about one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexcasting#he.title: Erase Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexcasting#he.text: Clear a Hex-containing item in my other hand. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.title: Summon Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.text: Summons my [sentinel](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/sentinels) at the given position. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.title: Banish Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.text: Banish my [sentinel](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/sentinels), and remove it from the world. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.title: Locate Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.text: Add the position of my [sentinel](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/sentinels) to the stack, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it isn't summoned. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.title: Wayfind Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinels#hex.text: Transform the position vector on the top of the stack into a unit vector pointing from that position to my [sentinel](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/sentinels), or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if it isn't summoned. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/colorize#hexc.title: Internalize Pigment
hexcasting:patterns/spells/colorize#hexc.text: I must be holding a [Pigment](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/pigments) in my other hand to cast this spell. When I do, it will consume the dye and permanently change my mind's coloration (at least, until I cast the spell again). Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Conjure Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Conjures a speck with the iota, position, and rotation. Costs a negligible amount of media. Pushes the speck iota to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Move Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Moves a speck entity to the position.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Rotate Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Rotates a speck entity to face the vector.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Roll Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Accepts a number between 0 and 1, representing a fraction of a full rotation, and rotates the speck's image by that amount.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Time Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Commands the speck to disappear after that many twentieths of a second.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Resize Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Scales the speck, can range from 0 to 10. Represents size in blocks and is zero by default.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Thicken Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Changes the stroke thickness of a pattern speck, can range from 0 to 10. Represents twentieths of a block, and is zero by default.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Paint Speck
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Splashes a pigment iota onto the speck, changing its color after creation.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.title: Zone Dstl.: Specklike
hexcasting:patterns/spells/specks#hexica.text: Returns specks similarly to other [zone distillation](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/entities@hexcasting:zone_entity/animal) patterns.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/cyclevariant#.title: Caster's Glamour
hexcasting:patterns/spells/cyclevariant#.text: Certain items I create seem oddly receptive to the influence of media. By holding a [Cypher](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), [Trinket](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), [Artifact](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting), [Focus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus), or [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) in my other hand, I can use this spell to change the appearance of the item. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/paint_conjure.title: Externalize Pigment
hexcasting:patterns/spells/paint_conjure.text: Accepts a vector and an itemtype representing a pigment. Costs a negligible amount of media if targeting my own block, or 1 Amethyst Dust if not.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.title: Postman's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.text: Accepts a player and any iota less than 256 characters long, and shows that iota to them as if they had cast Reveal, also telling them who sent the message. Cost is inversely proportional to the length of time since they were last targeted by this spell.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.title: Postage Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.text: Accepts a player and returns how much amethyst dust it would cost to send them a message via Postman's Gambit, between 1/10 of a dust and 10 dust.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.title: Postman's Gambit II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/reveal_other#.text: Resets the cost of sending me a message via Postman's Gambit back to 1/10 of a dust. Costs 1/10 of a dust.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particle_burs.title: Particle Burst
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particle_burs.text: Accepts two vectors and two numbers, and uses them to define a burst of particles. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.title: Anchorite's Flight
hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.text: A flight limited in its range.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.title: Wayfarer's Flight
hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.text: A flight limited in its duration.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.title: Aviator's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/flight#hexcas.text: Returns whether the given player is under the effects of [Anchorite's](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/flight@hexcasting:flight/range) or [Wayfarer's Flight](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/flight@hexcasting:flight/time).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.title: Terminate Flight
hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.text: Cancels my current flight ability, at a cost of one tenth of an Amethyst Dust. Casting a new flight spell in the same instant allows me to continue flying, potentially with different parameters.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.title: Aviator's Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.text: Returns true if the target is under the effects of Anchorite's Flight, false if Wayfarer's Flight, null if neither.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.title: Aviator's Purification III
hexcasting:patterns/spells/ephemeral_fli.text: Returns how close the target is to the end of their flight spell, represented as either their distance to the boundary or how many seconds remain.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/villager_slee.title: Induce Exhaustion
hexcasting:patterns/spells/villager_slee.text: Causes the villager to seek out its bed and take a short nap. Not effective if the villager lacks a bed to use. Costs one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.title: Transition: Feminine
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.text:
Transitions the caster to a female!
I wonder how I'd look in a skirt...

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.title: Transition: Masculine
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.text:
Transitions the caster to a male!
No more periods!

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.title: Transition: Non-binary
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.text:
Transitions the caster to androgynous!
Hmm... this is... interesting...

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.title: Gender Identity Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gender_intero.text: Obtains the target's selected gender as an ordinal (number)

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Gravitate
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Takes an entity, an axial vector for new gravity, and a strength scalar relative to standard pull. Specifics are detailed on the next page.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Grasp Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Pushes the remaining twentieths of a second that [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity) will affect an entity. Zero if the entity is not under the effects of [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Falling Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Pushes the direction that [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity) is attempting to drag an entity, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the entity is not under the effects of [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Impact Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Pushes the scaling factor of [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity)'s gravity compared to baseline, or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if the entity is not under the effects of [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Falling Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Pushes the direction of Gravity acting on an entity.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.title: Impact Purification II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/gravity#hexod.text: Pushes strength of Gravity acting on an entity compared to baseline.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.title: Smelt
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.text: Remove a location, item entity, or mote from the stack, then either smelt the block at the location or smelt all the items in the item entity or mote.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.title: Freeze
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.text: Freezes the block at a block location. For example, turns water into ice, and ice into packed ice. Costs one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.title: Falling Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.text: Remove a location from the stack, and force the block there to fall as if it were sand or gravel. Costs one and a half [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.title: Place Block II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.text: Accepts an item type or mote and a location, and attempts to place a block of that item type at that location. If a mote was passed it will instead place from the record referenced by that mote. Costs an eighth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.title: Particles
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexal_spells#.text: Accepts a location or a list of locations, and either creates a particle at the location, or creates lines of particles between the locations in the list. Costs two thousandths of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per location.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Confetti
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Creates a loud bang similar to that of [Fireworks](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/spells/pyrotechnics) and a burst of colorful particles, either in a direction or in a radial blast. Costs about half of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Vibrate
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Causes a visible pulse of vibration from a vector to an entity or vector over a number of seconds. Costs about a sixteenth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Sparkle
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Produces a small sparkling particle of my desired position, color, and lifespan. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Crack Device
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Cracks the unprogrammed [casting device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting) or [Curio](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#items/curios) in my offhand. Cracked casting devices proudly display their Hexes. Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Conjure Flower
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Conjures a flower of my choosing at a location. I must have identified this flower at some point before. Costs about a quarter of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Illuminate
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Conjures a completely invisible light with illumination strength of my choosing at a location. Costs about a quarter of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Gasp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Instantly replenishes a creature's air bubbles. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.title: Squawk
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hexical_spell.text: Emits a sound associated with a mob near a location, as though a parrot had imitated that mob. Costs about a half of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.title: Conjure Egg
hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.text: Conjures an egg. May be fertile. Costs about two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.title: Conjure Spit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.text: Conjures a sticky low-damaging projectile. Costs about a fourth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.title: Conjure Snowball
hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.text: Conjures a harmless snowball. Costs about half of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.title: Conjure Fireball
hexcasting:patterns/spells/projectiles#h.text: Conjures an explosive fireball that can be *percussively propelled*. Costs about three [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Lay Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: It is much easier to store an item into a Vessel than to pull it out. This pattern simply takes an Item Entity, and neatly sorts it into the activated Storage Vessels. Costs an 1/8th of a [dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per activated Vessel.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Get Vessels
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: This simply returns what Vessels the current [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) has activated. I should likely use this to check if the [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) has collected any Vessels.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Reawaken Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: This takes a Hex and runs it on every [Item Stack](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexpose/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/scrying/item) stored (with it on top of the stack). Once the Hex is executed, it requires a Integer, Vector, and Boolean, left on the stack, in that order.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Check Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: Check Item functions much like Reawaken Item; however, it only requires a Boolean from the inputted Hex. If the Boolean is ever True, the spell ends, and returns True.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Reorient Items
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: In some rare scenarios, Vessels can get jumbled up and have items of the same type spread across different  Vessels. This is a neat spell to resort them at a cost. That cost being 5 [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Set Recipe
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text: Sets the crafting recipe of a [Patterned Assembler](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/crafting_loci). Takes a list of [Nulls](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences), items, or item variants, and applies it to the targeted [Assembler](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/crafting_loci).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Bind Macro
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text:
This binds both a pattern and an iota to a [Spell Imprinter](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/macro_loci), which is at the targeted vector. 
Does not mishap if casted outside of a [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles). Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.title: Review Broadcast
hexcasting:patterns/spells/storage_loci#.text:
Attempts to read an [Iotic Door](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/broadcaster_loci) at the given vector. If there is not a [Door](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/broadcaster_loci), returns garbage. 
Does not mishap if casted outside of a [Spell Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles), free, and does not require ambit.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinel_loci.title: Apply Pseudosentinels
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinel_loci.text: This takes a list of vectors, and attempts to move the Pseudosentinels to the positions.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinel_loci.title: Locate Pseudosentinels
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sentinel_loci.text: This retrieves the current positions of all Pseudosentinels in the order they were awoken. Free to cast.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/break_special.title: Extract Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/break_special.text: Targets structural faults in a block, resulting in a higher yield. Costs about one, three, and five [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) when power input is 0, 1, and 2 respectively.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/break_special.title: Collect Block
hexcasting:patterns/spells/break_special.text: Breaks a block gently, perserving the block better than standard mining. Costs about half of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Summon Projectile Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: This wisp is summoned and launched like an arrow, casting its hex on whatever it hits. The initial stack when it executes will be a reference to itself, then a reference to what it hit.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Summon Cyclic Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Similar to Summon Projectile Wisp, but with only one vector input for the position to summon the wisp. Cyclic wisps are unmoving once summoned, instead executing their hex up to 20 times each second.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Identity Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Add a reference to the casting wisp to the stack. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Reservoir Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Add the amount of media in the wisp's reservoir to the stack. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Manager's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Removes a reference to a wisp from the stack, and replaces it with the wisp's contained hex. Must be a wisp you summoned, or a wisp that has [allowed](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/wisps@hexal:wisp/transfer/allow) transfer with the caster or caster's owner.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Allegiance Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Removes a reference to a wisp and an entity from the stack, and returns true if that entity owns that wisp, and false otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Pathfinder's Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Removes a position vector from the stack; The Cyclic Wisp that executed this pattern will move in a straight line towards that position (colliding with terrain in its path) until it reaches it.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Pathfinder's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Adds to the stack the position vector that the executing Cyclic Wisp is currently moving towards.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Haste
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Removes a number from the stack, and sets the executing Cyclic Wisp's maximum speed to that number.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Speedometer's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Gets the executing Cyclic Wisp's current maximum speed.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Allow Transfer
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: When two wisps are [linked](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links) together, they transfer media between each other until they are balanced. By default this only happens between wisps with the same owner. This takes an index, and explicitly allows the wisp to exchange media with the linkable at that index.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Disallow Transfer
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Correspondingly, this takes an index and disallows the wisp from exchanging media with the linkable at that index.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Allow Transfer Others
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: This takes a wisp that you own and an index, and allows the wisp to exchange media with the linkable at that index.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Disallow Transfer Others
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: This takes a wisp that you own and an index, and disallows the wisp from exchanging media with the linkable at that index.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:g.title: Entity Prfn.: Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:g.text: Transform the position on the stack into the wisp at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:z.title: Zone Dstl.: Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:z.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of wisps near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:z.title: Zone Dstl.: Non-Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:z.text: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-wisp entities near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Delay Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: Removes an integer from the stack, then delays the wisp's next cast until at least that many twentieth's of a second have passed. This and other triggers like it will halve the wisp's upkeep cost while it isn't casting.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Listen
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: The wisp's next cast will not occur until it has received at least one [communication](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links@hexal:link/comm/send).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.title: Wander
hexcasting:patterns/spells/wisps#hexal:w.text: The wisp's next cast will not occur until it has reached the position it is [navigating](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/wisps@hexal:wisp/move/target/set) towards.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Link
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Links the caster to the entity removed from the stack, which must be linkable. This costs one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Link Others
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: May be evaluated by any casting instrument. Links two entities, which must be linkable. This costs one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Unlink
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Removes the link at the given index from the caster's links. This costs two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Unlink Others
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Takes two linkables and unlinks them if they are linked. This costs two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Phonebook Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Removes an index from the stack, and adds the entity connected to the link at that index to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Recognition Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Removes an entity from the stack, and adds the index to the link to that entity to the stack (or -1 if the caster isn't linked to that entity).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Popularity Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Adds the number of links to the wisp to the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Send Iota
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Removes an iota from the stack, then removes an index from the stack and sends the iota along the link at the given index.  This costs one hundredth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Recitation Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: When something receives an iota along a link it is added to a queue. This pattern adds the first iota in the queue to the stack, removing it from the queue.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Postmaster's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Adds to the stack the number of unread iota in the caster's received iota queue.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Unclogging Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Removes all unread iota from the caster's received iota queue.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Open Transmit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: Similar to [Introspection](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/patterns_as_iotas@hexcasting:open_paren), until drawing a [Close Transmit](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links@hexal:link/comm/close_transmit) all patterns I draw are sent along the link whose index is at the top of the stack.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.title: Close Transmit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/links#hexal:l.text: When drawn after [Open Transmit](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links@hexal:link/comm/open_transmit) I stop transmitting drawn patterns. If either [Open Transmit](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links@hexal:link/comm/open_transmit) or [Close Transmit](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/links@hexal:link/comm/close_transmit) are executed by an intermediary caster such as a wisp, they will mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.title: Network Dstln.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.text: Scans the link network connected to the input linkable up to a recursion depth equal to the input number (max 32), and returns a list of all connected linkables. Costs a negligible amount of media.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.title: Network Gateway
hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.text: Accepts an entity to teleport, a linkable to use for access to its network, and a destination. If the entity is within 8 blocks of the linkable, and there is a network node within 4 blocks of the destination, the entity will be teleported. Cost varies based on what entity is teleported.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.title: Routing Dstln.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/network#ephem.text: Accepts a linkable to use for network access, and any iota. If a relay connected to the network has an adjacent Network Routing Index with the same iota, returns that relay's position. Costs half an amethyst dust.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Bind Storage
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Target a Mote Nexus block in the world and bind yourself to it, meaning all items you mediafy will be added to that nexus' capacity. Targeting any other block will unbind you from your currently bound nexus. Costs 32 [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Bind Storage - Temp.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Target a Mote Nexus block in the world and bind to it for the remainder of this cast, temporarily overriding your primary binding. Costs one thousandth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Stocktake Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Gets all the types of motes contained in the currently bound Mote Nexus.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Stocktake Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Gets all the mote records from the currently bound Mote Nexus that match the passed item type or could be combined with the passed mote.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Capacity Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Gets the remaining capacity of the bound Mote Nexus.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Containment Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Returns true if the Mote Nexus at the given position contains a mote of the given type, or that would stack with the given mote, and false otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Mediafy Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Convert an item in the world (either an item entity or an item frame) into a mote on your stack. If passed an existing mote instead adds the items from the entity to the mote. Mediafying an item costs a tenth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Return Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Returns all the items from a mote to the world at the location of your choosing. If passed a number returns at most that many items. Costs a tenth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#moreiot.title: Sorter's Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#moreiot.text: Accepts a mote and returns an [Item Stack](https://moreiotas.hexxy.media/v/0.1.1/1.0/en_us#casting/item_iotas) representing the items in the record referenced by that mote.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexcast.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexcast.text: Accepts a mote and returns the number of items in the record referenced by that mote.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexcast.title: Additive Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexcast.text: Combines two motes into one, merging the mote records they point to. Any pointers to the second mote will become null, any pointers to the first will remain. This can make motes holding many more items than I could carry in a stack naturally!

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Stacking Distillation II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Returns true if the first mote can be combined with the items in the second argument (which can be a mote, item stack, item entity, or item frame), and false otherwise.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Splitting Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Splits the specified number of items off of the passed mote, creating a new mote pointing to a new mote record.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Depot Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Get the position of the Mote Nexus that contains the passed mote.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Depot Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Move the record referenced by the passed mote to the Mote Nexus at the passed position. This returns a new mote pointing to that record, and invalidates all previous motes pointing to that record.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Craft
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Takes a mote, list of motes, or list of list of motes. returns a list containing the results of crafting with those items. For example, the input Stone x128 would return [Stone Button x128].

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Preview Craft
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Takes the same input as [Craft](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/motes@hexal:mote/craft), except it can take Item Stack Iotas as well as motes. Returns a list of Item Stack Iotas representing what the results of [Craft](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/motes@hexal:mote/craft) would have been with motes containing those inputs.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Seniority Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Accepts a villager, returns a number representing that villager's seniority and skill at their craft.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Offering Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Accepts a villager and returns all of the trades that villager is offering. This is a list of lists of lists. Each trade comprises two lists, the cost, and the returned items. The returned items is a list containing the type of item, and the number of items.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Trade
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Accepts a villager, a list of motes to trade with to villager, and optionally an int for which of that villager's trades to attempt. (int? above means that you can pass 2 or 3 arguments, the optional 3rd being an int).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.title: Use Item On
hexcasting:patterns/spells/motes#hexal:m.text: Accepts a mote, and either an entity, or a target block and a normal vector. Uses the item on the entity/block. The mote must either only have one item in it, or the items contained must be extremely simple (no NBT data).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.title: Hex Gummy
hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.text: Conjures a Hex Gummy: a delightful light snack that also provides about a tenth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)'s worth of media. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.title: Conjure Hexburst
hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.text: Conjures a Hexburst of the given iota at the location. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) and is subject to the Transgress Others mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.title: Conjure Hextito
hexcasting:patterns/spells/conjurable_de.text: Conjures a Hextito of the given Hex at the location. Costs about two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) and is subject to the Transgress Others mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/spike#hexical.title: Conjure Spike
hexcasting:patterns/spells/spike#hexical.text: Takes a non-air position, an axis vector, and a delay in seconds up to ten seconds long and conjures a spike at that location. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/http_spells#h.title: Request
hexcasting:patterns/spells/http_spells#h.text:
Sends an HTTP request made of the given data, method, and headers to the provided URL.
The Response is truthy if a response is received.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/http_spells#h.title: Get Response
hexcasting:patterns/spells/http_spells#h.text: Given a Response Iota, attempt to parse the results. Will Mishap if too early or an IOException is thrown.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Push
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: Takes a block position and an axis vector and pushes the block along that vector. Costs an eighth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Dispense
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: Takes an item entity, a position, and an axis vector and dispenses the item. For most applications, costs about half of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Cook
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: Takes an item entity and cooks it as if in a Furnace. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) for every ten seconds that the Furnace would need to have been active.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Roast
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: A specialized variant of [Cook](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/spells/block_mimicry@hexical:smelt) that simulates a Campfire instead. This has a much more limited set of possibilities; I am unsure why I would ever use this.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Smoke
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: A specialized variant of [Cook](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/spells/block_mimicry@hexical:smelt) that simulates a Smoker instead, making it unable to process anything but foods but at a faster rate, making the spell cheaper.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Blast
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: A specialized variant of [Cook](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/spells/block_mimicry@hexical:smelt) that simulates a Blast Furnace instead, making it unable to process anything but ores but at a faster rate, making the spell cheaper.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.title: Cut Stone
hexcasting:patterns/spells/block_mimicry.text: Takes an item entity and cuts the item into the shape of an item identifier. Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.title: Displace
hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.text: Teleports an entity within the [circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) to another point within the same [circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles). Unlike [Greater Teleport](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/teleport), this spell takes in world coordinates rather than an offset. Costs about half of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.title: Appendage
hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.text: Allows a [circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles) to hook onto a [Pedestal](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#items/pedestals) within ambit to use as its *other arm*. Useful for certain spells that demand an item held in my other hand. It also works as a [Wristpocket](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#patterns/spells/wristpocket).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.title: Export Media
hexcasting:patterns/spells/circle_spells.text: Exports media out of an [Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) at a rate of about eleven [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) spent per ten [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) created. Takes a location and a number of up to a stack of [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.title: Inculcate
hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.text:
Etches a Hex, allowing me to cast it by holding Evoke for one second. Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).
*Anthony thought at it, and it turned a flip-flop on the grass, and lay trembling, its eyes gleaming in small black terror.*

hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.title: Evocation Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.text: Pushes the Hex etched into my mind.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.title: Evoker Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/evocation#hex.text: Pushes how long since a player has been evoking. Is -1 if they are not currently evoking.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hopper#hexica.title: Hopper
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hopper#hexica.text: Instantly transports all items from source to destination. Cost scales based on the amount of mass transferred - a stack of 64 items will cost about three [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Numbers are optional; details later.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hopper#hexica.title: Hopper Purification
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hopper#hexica.text: Applies to sources that support slots; inventories. Returns a list of the item stacks contained within them, with their index in the list being their slot number.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hotbar#hexica.title: Handy Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hotbar#hexica.text: Pushes a number relating to which of my current items I am currently holding.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/hotbar#hexica.title: Switch
hexcasting:patterns/spells/hotbar#hexica.text:
Takes a number 0 to 8 and switches my current item to it.
*Remember, switching to your pistol is always faster than reloading.*
