hexcasting:patterns/spells/rename#hexica.title: Name Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/rename#hexica.text: Takes an item and renames it to the text given. Resets name if given [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences). Free.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/rename#hexica.title: Describe Item
hexcasting:patterns/spells/rename#hexica.text: Takes an item and a list of text to append as a description. Clears if given [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences). Free.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/lesser_sentin.title: Deploy Sentinels
hexcasting:patterns/spells/lesser_sentin.text: Dismisses any existing Lesser Sentinels and deploys a Lesser Sentinel at every position in the list.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/lesser_sentin.title: Infiltration Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/lesser_sentin.text: Returns a list of vectors corresponding to the positions of all my Lesser Sentinels.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/pyrotechnics#.title: Simulate Firework
hexcasting:patterns/spells/pyrotechnics#.text: Analyzes the Firework Star in my other hand and conjures a firework of that star, with the position, velocity, and gunpowder amount specified. Costs about one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/pyrotechnics#.title: Conjure Firework
hexcasting:patterns/spells/pyrotechnics#.text: Conjures a firework of my *exact* specifications. It may be one of the most complex spells in existence. Costs equivalently to the other firework spell.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Clear Vision
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Breaks any shader spell currently applied to me. Useful for "bleaching" my eyes after too much experimentation.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Pierce Darkness
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Greatly augments my ability to see in the dark, although the light resultingly becomes extremely blinding.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Visualize Forms
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Transforms the world into a thin outline of black and white. Possibly useful for identifying subtle contrasts.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Broadcast Vision
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Alters my vision to contain strange lines and make objects towards the center of my vision bulge "towards" me. Seems to be in reference to something...

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Identify Importance
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Transforms my vision to perceive only the most important things...

hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.title: Split Vision
hexcasting:patterns/spells/shaders#hexic.text: Splits my vision into multiple sections, similar to what a spider might see. I am unsure whether it actually grants me more vision...

hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.title: Devour Structure
hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.text:
Removes the locations of two corners from the stack, then consumes a region of space defined by those two corners, storing the result in a Structure iota.
Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) for every block consumed.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.title: Actualize Structure
hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.text:
Removes the location of the structure's origin and a structure from the stack, then attempts to place the structure at the origin, erasing the structure from all memory. Mishaps if any part of the structure overlaps with another block.
Costs about an eighth of one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) for every block placed.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.title: Visualize Structure
hexcasting:patterns/spells/structure_spe.text: Removes the location of the structure's origin and a structure from the stack, followed by a duration between 0 and 72000.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/targetted#efh.title: Haunt
hexcasting:patterns/spells/targetted#efh.text: Sets a list of players to be exclusively influenced by my special effects. If [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences), all can see my effects again.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Particulate Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Pushes the last sixteen unique particles picked up by my [Microphone](https://miyucomics.github.io/special-efhexs/v/latest/main/en_us#items/microphone).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Particle
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a particular particle with a specified position and velocity (blocks per twentieth of a second). Costs about 1/32th of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Dust
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a small mote of dust of a given color. The number relates vaguely to scale and lifespan.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Sparkly Dust
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a gradient-like mote of dust, which smoothly transitions between the two colors given over the given number of seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Debris
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a visual bit of debris, similar to that caused by breaking a block. Takes in a block identifier.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Sediment
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures particles similar to that caused by suspended gravity-affected blocks. Takes in a block identifier.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Fragments
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a visual bit of fragments, similar to that caused by a tool breaking after wearing. Takes in an item iota.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.title: Conjure Media
hexcasting:patterns/spells/particles#efh.text: Conjures a blob of visible media, not unlike the waste product of my Hexes. Takes in a color.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sounds#efhexs.title: Audio Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sounds#efhexs.text: Pushes the last sixteen unique sounds picked up by my [Microphone](https://miyucomics.github.io/special-efhexs/v/latest/main/en_us#items/microphone).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/sounds#efhexs.title: Play Sound
hexcasting:patterns/spells/sounds#efhexs.text: Plays a sound at a particular location, volume, and pitch. Costs about a sixteenth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/tree_spells#d.title: Transform
hexcasting:patterns/spells/tree_spells#d.text: Provided a tree's position, I can command Nature to change the very Species of the tree till my heart's content, provided I have the media equivalent of a Shard per character in the string which defines its' structure.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/marker_spells.title: Set Marker
hexcasting:patterns/spells/marker_spells.text:
Adds the provided marker to the map under the provided identifier
Ambit validation is done here

hexcasting:patterns/spells/marker_spells.title: Remove Marker
hexcasting:patterns/spells/marker_spells.text: Removed the marker on the map under the provided identifier

hexcasting:patterns/spells/horrible#hexi.title: Horrible
hexcasting:patterns/spells/horrible#hexi.text: Judging by the pattern signature, I can only imagine that it summons something.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/create_.title: Create Lava
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/create_.text: Summon a block of lava (or insert up to a bucket's worth) into a block at the given position. Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/infusem.title: Media Infusion
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/infusem.text: Accepts a vector and infuses media into the corresponding block in order to transmute it. Cost and exact effect vary depending on target.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/dim_tel.title: Noetic Gateway
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/dim_tel.text:
Accepts an entity and a Spatial Imprint and teleports the entity to its position in the proper dimension. Generally costs 20 Charged Amethyst.
Will fail if supplied a player other than myself.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/swap_sp.title: Spatial Interchange
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/swap_sp.text: Accepts two lists of two vectors, to define two cuboids, and a Spatial Imprint. These cuboids must have the exact same dimensions and rotation.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.title: Everett's Exaltation
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.text: Creates a new room for me

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.title: Everett's Abduction
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.text: You are going to ~~Brazil~~, ~~My Domain~~, *T H E   F U N   Z O N E*

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.title: Everett's Expulsion
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.text: G E T   O U T

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.title: Everett's Timing Prfn.
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/dimensi.text: How much longer must I wait

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.title: Summon Lightning
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.text: I command the heavens! This spell will summon a bolt of lightning to strike the earth where I direct it. Costs about three [Amethyst Shards](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.title: Summon Rain
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.text: I control the clouds! This spell will summon rain across the world I cast it upon. Costs about one [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Does nothing if it is already raining.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.title: Dispel Rain
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/weather.text: A counterpart to summoning rain. This spell will dispel rain across the world I cast it upon. Costs about one [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Does nothing if the skies are already clear.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/altiora.title: Altiora
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/altiora.text: Summon a sheaf of media about me in the shape of wings, endowed with enough substance to allow gliding.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/infusio.title: Infuse Will
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/infusio.text:
Takes a pattern and makes it unique to me by injecting patterns that I cannot draw by hand
also seems to put more power into certain spells

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Charm
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: Charms an item. Takes the item to charm, the Hex, and an amount of media in [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). Consumes that amount and about three [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Charmed Gambit
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: Writes an iota to the charmed item’s internal storage. Subject to the Transgress Others mishap.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Charmed Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: Pushes the stored iota from the charmed item’s internal storage.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Charmed Gambit II
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: If the item charged features an iota storage by default, such as a [Focus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus), writes an iota into it.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Charmed Reflection II
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: If the item charged features an iota storage by default, such as a [Focus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus), reads an iota from it.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.title: Discharm
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/charm#h.text: Removes a charm from an item without affecting any other property. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/greater.title: Greater Blink
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/greater.text: Teleports me up to 128 blocks away, relative to my position and rotation. Costs about two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/telepor.title: Greater Teleport
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/telepor.text: Far more powerful than [Blink](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/basic@hexcasting:blink), this spell lets me teleport nearly anywhere in the entire world! There does seem to be a limit, but it is *much* greater than the normal radius of influence I am used to.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.title: Induce Mending
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.text: Accepts a raw media item on the ground, and attempts to use it to repair a tool in my other hand.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.title: Menderbug's Rfln.
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.text: Returns how many times the item in my other hand can be used without breaking, durability-manipulating effects notwithstanding.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.title: Menderbug's Rfln. II
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/mending.text: As previous, targeting the item in the hand I'm casting this with. Most useful with delayed casts of one form or another.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/magearm.title: Instant Aegis
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/magearm.text: Accepts a player to grant the armor to, the durability of the armor, the protection value of the armor (max 10), a status effect to apply, and that effect's level. The latter two can be replaced with any non-status iota to ignore them.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/invisib.title: Hidden Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/invisib.text: Functions just like the normal [Zeniths](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/zeniths), applying Invisibility. Costs one amethyst dust per three seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.title: White Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.text: Bestows regeneration. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per second.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.title: Blue Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.text: Bestows night vision. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 5 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.title: Black Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.text: Bestows absorption. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per second.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.title: Red Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.text: Bestows haste. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 3 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.title: Green Sun's Zenith
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/zeniths.text: Bestows strength. Base cost is one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per 3 seconds.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/detecti.title: Stealth Shroud
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/detecti.text: Accepts a living entity and a number (*n*), and shields the entity from hex-based detection for *n* seconds. Costs two amethyst dust per second.

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/detecti.title: Discern Shroud
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/detecti.text: Accepts a vector and a number, and returns a list of unit vectors pointing from the initial vector to shrouded entities within a radius defined by the number.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/greater.title: Summon Greater Sentinel
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/greater.text: Summon a greater version of my [Sentinel](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/sentinels). Costs about two [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/glow_am.title: Uplifting Resonance
hexcasting:patterns/spells/great/glow_am.text: Accepts a living entity, and allows it to be accessed from anywhere for one minute. Has a base cost of one amethyst shard, plus one additional shard per application before allowing it to expire.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/make_ba.title: Craft Phial
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/make_ba.text: Infuse a bottle with media to form a [Phial.](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/phials)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/brainsw.title: Flay Mind
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/brainsw.text: I cannot make heads or tails of this spell... To be honest, I'm not sure I want to know what it does.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Summon Block Display
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text:
Summons a Block Display entity at the given position, displaying the given block. (The string must be the internal name i.e "minecraft:dirt", not "Dirt").
Costs about a [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Summon Item Display
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text:
Summons an Item Display entity at the given position, displaying the given item (The string must be the internal name i.e "minecraft:stick", not "Stick").
Costs about a [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Summon Text Display
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Summons a Text Display entity at the given position, displaying the given string. Costs about a [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Entity Purification: BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Transform the position on the stack into the BIT at that location (or [Null](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#casting/influences) if there isn't one)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Zone Distillation: BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Take a position and a maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of BIT's near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Zone Distillation: Not BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Take a position and a maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-BIT's near the position.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Translate BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Translates the BIT to the given offset.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Rotate BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Rotates the BIT to the given Quaternion.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Scale BIT
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Scales the BIT to the given vector.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Get BIT 4x4
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Pushes a 4x4 matrix representing the Bit's Transformation.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.title: Set BIT 4x4
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/bits#co.text: Sets the Transformation of a BIT to the given 4x4 matrix.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/tick#he.title: Accelerate
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/tick#he.text: Causes the block at the passed vector to perform its normal actions faster in the instant that this spell is cast.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.title: Consume Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.text: Remove a wisp from the stack, and disassemble the wisp. The patterns contained are lost, but the media that it contained can be repurposed if this spell is cast by another wisp.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.title: Bind Wisp
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.text: Bind one of my wisps closer to me; I may only have one bound wisp at a time, but whichever wisp is bound costs significantly less upkeep and increased range.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.title: Familiar's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/great_w.text: Returns my currently bound wisp. A new wisp can only be bound when this returns null. (This is not a great spell, I have simply placed it here for convenience.)

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Gate's Reflection
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Adds a new gate iota to the stack. Any copy of this iota will point to the same numbered gate. Costs 32 [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst). If passed null, makes a Drifting Gate. If passed a vector, makes a Location Anchored Gate, If passed a vector and an entity, makes an Entity Anchored Gate.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Gate's Opening
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Consumes a gate iota and an entity. Marks that entity to be teleported the next time that gate is closed. Costs one twentieth of an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Gate's Dismissal
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Consumes a gate iota and an entity. Unmarks that entity so that if it was marked with [ Gate's Opening](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/great_spells/gates@hexal:gate/mark) it will no longer be teleported the next time that gate is closed.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Length Purification
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Consumes a gate iota, returns how many entities are marked by that gate.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Marked Distillation
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Consumes a gate iota and an entity, returns whether that entity is marked by that gate.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.title: Gate's Closing
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/gates#h.text: Consumes a non-drifing gate iota, or a drifting gate iota and a position. Transports all the entities marked with the passed gate to the stored or given position, as relevant. Costs half an [Amethyst Shard](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst), plus an [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) per metre transported per entity, if the gate was drifting.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.title: Conjure Mesh
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.text: Conjures a mesh with the location and leaves a mesh entity on the stack. Costs about one [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst).

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.title: Weave Mesh
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.text: Takes a list of vectors, with constraints defined on the prior page, and weaves the mesh into that shape. Free.

hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.title: Tangle Purification
hexcasting:patterns/great_spells/meshes#.text: Pushes the shape of a mesh as a list of vectors.

hexical:lightning_rod_staff.name: Lightning Rod Staff
hexical:lightning_rod_staff.description: By fixing a Block of Amethyst to some Lightning Rods, I can make quite the impressive [Staff](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff). It is quite weighty to wield but feels absolutely *electrifying* to use.

hexical:gauntlet_staff.name: Gauntlet Staff
hexical:gauntlet_staff.description: [Staves](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/staff) are quite heavy to wield and finnicky to hold. Should I tire of them, I can construct a gauntlet-like device that will allow me to grasp and warp the media to my will with my own hands.

lapisworks:energy_container.name: Enchantment Energy Container
lapisworks:energy_container.description: Works the same way but stores 16 stacks and cannot be put on my belt due to it's unwieldiness. It can, however, be left in my hotbar and will still function.

lapisworks:mind.name: Simple Mind Container
lapisworks:mind.description: The Amel will let the machine eat bits and pieces of villager minds, taking "snapshots" of the flow of media within. A Diamond should focus it enough to mimic the precision of natural minds. The Charged Amethyst will hold the mind.

hexcasting:lens.name: Scrying Lens
hexcasting:lens.description: *You must learn... to see what you are looking at.*

hexcasting:thought_knot.name: Thought-Knot
hexcasting:thought_knot.description: *How would you feel if someone saw you wearing a sign that said, "I am dashing and handsome?"*

hexdebug:debugger.name: Debugger
hexdebug:debugger.description:
*Thwack!*
I can also switch between different "step modes" of the Debugger by sneak-scrolling (like with a [Spellbook](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/spellbook) or [Abacus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/abacus)).

hexdebug:splicing_table.name: Splicing Table
hexdebug:splicing_table.description: *She plugged in strings one after the other, the tiny metal cubes flying in and out as her fingers danced over the tray with blinding speed.*

hexical:grimoire.name: Grimoire
hexical:grimoire.description: By encrusting an Enchanted Book with [Charged Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) and [Edified Wood](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/edified), it traps media within the pages like an echo chamber. I can then introduce up to 512 pattern-to-pattern-list bindings for the Grimoire to keep bouncing endlessly inside.

hexical:scarab_beetle.name: Scarab Beetle
hexical:scarab_beetle.description: I can instruct my scarab how to judge these "illegal" patterns and how to replace it with a different set of patterns instead. This allows me to make *new* patterns that work seamlessly for only me, even in [casting devices](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/hexcasting).

hexcasting:spellbook.name: Spellbook
hexcasting:spellbook.description: *Wizards love words. Most of them read a great deal, and indeed one strong sign of a potential wizard is the inability to get to sleep without reading something first.*

hexical:casting_carpet.name: Casting Carpet
hexical:casting_carpet.description: *Why is the red carpet red? It can be any color.*

hexical:hex_candle.name: Hex Candle
hexical:hex_candle.description:
Like with regular Candles, I can place them on Cakes as well.
*The doctor found himself in an immense cave lined with countless quivering candles, each representing the duration of a life.*

hexical:media_jar.name: Media Jar
hexical:media_jar.description: *There, sure enough, she saw the faint translucent outline of something aboout the size of a hen's egg. There was just a touch of color in it, a pale sea-green, soft and shimmering and very beautiful.*

minecraft:sugar.name: Sugar
minecraft:sugar.description: The fruit that this bush produces is quite sweet, and can be processed into sugar. Additionally, it releases bits of media during digestion, which seek out rechargeable items on my person. I should be wary of the thorns while picking the fruit.

hexcasting:scroll.name: Large Scroll
hexcasting:scroll.description: *I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets.*

oneironaut:wisp_battery.name: Wisp Weaver
oneironaut:wisp_battery.description:
Simply apply a redstone signal to activate. Produces a wisp every four seconds, and consumes two charged amethyst to do so.
The capacity and fill level of the phial used make no difference.

oneironaut:decorative_wisp_battery.name: Lesser Wisp Weaver
oneironaut:decorative_wisp_battery.description:
Alternatively, I can create a version which does not consume (or accept) any media, but produces wisps which yield only net-zero media when consumed.
All the sparkly shiny orbs, none of the prohibitive cost!

oneironaut:wisp_capture_device.name: Wisp Wrangler
oneironaut:wisp_capture_device.description: When releasing a cyclic wisp, it is placed on the side of the block I use the item on. Projectile wisps are launched from my face, retaining their previous speed (but not direction). To discard a contained wisp, I need only use the item while crouching.

hexical:media_log.name: Media Log
hexical:media_log.description: They call it the ~~Error~~ Media Log. I simply stab a shard of [Amethyst](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) through an [Edified Log](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/edified) and for some reason, Nature is now ready to spill my errors straight into my mind.

oneironaut:library_card.name: Akashic Library Card
oneironaut:library_card.description: *It seems to exude some kind of sticky gloop.*

hexcasting:artifact.name: Artifact
hexcasting:artifact.description: *We have a saying in our field: "Magic isn't". It doesn't "just work," it doesn't respond to your thoughts, you can't throw fireballs or create a roast dinner from thin air or turn a bunch of muggers into frogs and snails.*

oneironaut:reverberation_rod.name: Reverberation Rod
oneironaut:reverberation_rod.description: The echo shards seem to bear some bizarre form of media, with a tendency to loop back on itself while retaining a bit of the previous cast.

oneironaut:echo_staff.name: Echo Staff
oneironaut:echo_staff.description: Echo shards can also be used in the construction of a staff, though it seems the only special property of such a staff is making sculk sounds.

hextended:staff/drawing_orb.name: Drawing Orb
hextended:staff/drawing_orb.description:
Accepts any iota, but only amplifies signals from entities.
*who up pondering they orb*

oneironaut:hover_elevator.name: Hexcaster's Hoverlift
oneironaut:hover_elevator.description: *Best to don some long fall boots the first time I try these.*

oneironaut:hover_repeater.name: Hoverlift Repeater
oneironaut:hover_repeater.description: Fortunately, this device seems to be rather immaterial for some reason, and I can pass straight through it without having to carefully twist around it in the stream.*No, it does not make the stream pause for a moment before continuing.*

hexical:lei.name: Lei
hexical:lei.description: Once I have recovered some [Periwinkles](https://hexical.hexxy.media/v/latest/main/en_us#items/periwinkle), I can string the flowers into a Lei! The Lei provides a few boons reminiscent of the [Scrying Lens](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/lens), although noticeably weaker.

hexical:sentinel_bed.name: Sentinel Bed
hexical:sentinel_bed.description: *A comfy bed for my sentinel, it always seems eager to return to it.*

hexcasting:jeweler_hammer.name: Jeweler's Hammer
hexcasting:jeweler_hammer.description: *Carefully, she cracked the half ruby, letting the spren escape.*

hexodus:ballast.name: Ballast
hexodus:ballast.description: A Ballast seems to generate its own forces. [Gravitate](https://miyucomics.github.io/hexodus/v/1.0.0/1.0.0/en_us#patterns/spells/gravity@hexodus:change_gravity) can only scale and redirect existing forces; a Ballast can restore order even regular forces do not apply.

hexcasting:ancient_scroll_paper_lantern.name: Ancient Paper Lantern
hexcasting:ancient_scroll_paper_lantern.description: Brown dye works well enough to simulate the look of an [ancient scroll](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/scroll).

hexcasting:amethyst_tiles.name: Amethyst Tiles
hexcasting:amethyst_tiles.description:
[Amethyst Tiles](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/decoration) can also be made in a Stonecutter.
[Blocks of Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/decoration) (next page) will fall like sand.

hexcasting:amethyst_sconce.name: Amethyst Sconce
hexcasting:amethyst_sconce.description: [Amethyst Sconces](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/decoration) emit light and particles, as well as a pleasing chiming sound.

hexical:pedestal.name: Pedestal
hexical:pedestal.description: *A pedestal is as much a prison as any small, confined space.*

hexal:relay.name: Relay
hexal:relay.description: Relays have no owner, so if you want your wisps to [transfer media](https://hexal.hexxy.media/v/0.3.0/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/wisps@hexal:wisp/transfer/allow) with them you must specifically allow them to do so.

slate_work:whispering_stone.name: Whispering Stone
slate_work:whispering_stone.description: *Whispers and mutterances, gasps and fears, I can hear these faintly echo from this stone**. What was done to that shard**?*

hexchanting:amethyst_sword.name: Amethyst Sword
hexchanting:amethyst_sword.description: Swords cast on hit and push the targeted entity to the stack.

hexchanting:amethyst_arrow.name: Amethyst Arrow
hexchanting:amethyst_arrow.description: Arrows cast when striking an entity or a block. In the first case the entity is pushed to the stack, in the latter the block position. Arrows have an amethyst shard's worth of media and a 4 block ambit radius.

hexchanting:amethyst_helmet.name: Amethyst Helmet
hexchanting:amethyst_helmet.description: Helmets casts when a mob, hostile or otherwise, begins to target me. The identity of the mob is pushed to the stack.

hexchanting:amethyst_chestplate.name: Amethyst Chestplate
hexchanting:amethyst_chestplate.description: Chestplates cast when I take damage. Two nullable entities and the amount of damage are pushed to the stack. The first entity is the direct source of the damage, such as an arrow, and the second is the indirect source, such as whoever fired the arrow.

hexchanting:amethyst_leggings.name: Amethyst Leggings
hexchanting:amethyst_leggings.description: Leggings cast in the unfortunate event of my death. The source of my demise is pushed to the stack, in the same form as the chestplate. Because I am no longer alive to serve as a conduit this will always use the legging's internal media.

hexchanting:amethyst_boots.name: Amethyst Boots
hexchanting:amethyst_boots.description: Boots cast whenever I fall about 1.5 blocks, pushing the precise distance to the stack. This trigger is sensitive and can be fooled into resetting by going up.

efhexs:microphone.name: Microphone
efhexs:microphone.description:
I need to get up close and personally experience particles or sound to utilize it in my Hexes.
*Check, check, is this thing on?*

hexdebug:enlightened_splicing_table.name: Mindsplice Table
hexdebug:enlightened_splicing_table.description: Another [mindflaying](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/brainsweeping) ritual. The task demanded of the mind is almost identical to that of a [Toolsmith Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus), but more experience is required for this specialized, intricate work.

minecraft:budding_amethyst.name: Budding Amethyst
minecraft:budding_amethyst.description: And an application. For this flaying, any sort of villager will do, if it has developed enough. Other recipes require more specific types. NO MORE must I descend into the hellish earth for my media.

hexcasting:impetus/empty.name: Empty Impetus
hexcasting:impetus/empty.description: First, the cradle. Although it does not work as an [Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus), the flow of media in a circle will only exit out the side pointed to by the arrows. This allows me to change the plane in which the wave flows, for example.

hexcasting:impetus/rightclick.name: Toolsmith Impetus
hexcasting:impetus/rightclick.description: Then, to transpose the mind. Villagers of different professions will lend different actuation conditions to the resulting [Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus). A [Toolsmith Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) activates on a simple Use Item/Place Block.

hexcasting:impetus/redstone.name: Cleric Impetus
hexcasting:impetus/redstone.description: A [Cleric Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) activates when receiving a redstone signal. It may be bound to a player by using an item with a reference to that player, like a [Focus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/focus), on the block.

hexcasting:impetus/look.name: Fletcher Impetus
hexcasting:impetus/look.description: A [Fletcher Impetus](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) activates when looked at for a short time.

hexcasting:directrix/empty.name: Empty Directrix
hexcasting:directrix/empty.description: Firstly, a design for the cradle ... although, perhaps "substrate" would be more accurate a word. Without a mind guiding it, the output direction is determined by microscopic fluctuations in the media wave and surroundings, making it effectively random.

hexcasting:directrix/redstone.name: Mason Directrix
hexcasting:directrix/redstone.description: A [Mason Directrix](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/directrix) switches output side based on a redstone signal. Without a signal, the exit is the media-color side; with a signal, the exit is the redstone-color side.

hexcasting:directrix/boolean.name: Shepherd Directrix
hexcasting:directrix/boolean.description: A [Shepherd Directrix](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/directrix) switches output side based on a boolean on the stack. A True makes the wave exit from the back, a False from the front.

hexcasting:akashic_record.name: Akashic Record
hexcasting:akashic_record.description: Allocating and assigning patterns is simple but oh so boring. I have better things to do. I will need a mind well-used to its work for the extraction to stay sound.

oneironaut:super_budding.name: Budding Pseudoamethyst
oneironaut:super_budding.description: Pseudoamethyst requires a stronger mind than normal amethyst, but the cost is well worth it.

oneironaut:endless_phial.name: Inexhaustible Phial
oneironaut:endless_phial.description:
Constantly provides about a tenth of an amethyst dust worth of media. While I *can* hold several of these in order to gain access to more media, this results in rapidly-diminishing returns. 
I should be careful not to craft with the wrong phial.

oneironaut:bottomless_trinket.name: Bottomless Trinket
oneironaut:bottomless_trinket.description: I can also jam one into a trinket in order to replace its media supply with an inexhaustible phial, giving it access to the endless media within. However, it cannot use any media other than that provided by the phial.

hexcasting:quenched_allay.name: Quenched Allay
hexcasting:quenched_allay.description:
It matters not. I matter not. They matter not, all that matters is what it does. And this is it.
It must hurt so very much.
Ten [Amethyst Dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst) is the price to enact such a perverse ritual.

hexcasting:amethyst_dust.name: Amethyst Dust
hexcasting:amethyst_dust.description: They are mercurial, they seem to twist and wink under my fingers, and by giving them a mentor in another form of media they may be coerced into its shape, in an equivalent exchange of media.

oneironaut:sentinel_trap.name: Seer Impetus
oneironaut:sentinel_trap.description: As the sensor does not care whose sentinel it sees, I should take care to avoid allowing my trap circles to target me.

oneironaut:spacebomb.name: Slipcharge
oneironaut:spacebomb.description: The charge's physical structure directs the explosion along the hyperdimensional axis necessary to pierce spacetime, but I must still provide the vast amount of energy required. Approximately 200,000 Amethyst Dust worth of media, applied via Media Infusion, should do it. Perhaps I should draw on an existing slipway for this.

oneironaut:slipwaysuppressor.name: Slipway Suppressor
oneironaut:slipwaysuppressor.description: To use it, I must simply place it directly under a slipway and apply a redstone signal.

slate_work:allay_pigment.name: Quenched Pigment
slate_work:allay_pigment.description: Since my... *Visions*, I have awoken to see the true form of Allays, nothing more than a scrap of media. Perhaps this scrap of media could be turned into a picture perfect pigment?

slate_work:listening_impetus.name: Librarian Impetus
slate_work:listening_impetus.description: The first design freed and conceptualized is the Librarian Impetus. This reuses the Librarian's extensive vocabulary into a tool to understand what I say out loud.

slate_work:ambit_loci.name: Ambit Extender
slate_work:ambit_loci.description: Since the Ambit Extender operates on Ambit, having a "core" block that can operate on Media Waves would be beneficial. As well, having nearly [Pure Media](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/quenching_allays) would also be required for this construction.

slate_work:accelerator_loci.name: Gloopy Accelerator
slate_work:accelerator_loci.description:
While I could not recreate the lost material of "gloop," a mixture of slime and [Quenched Allay](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/quenching_allays) seems to emulate it well enough.
*This is glooptastic !*

slate_work:broadcaster_loci.name: Iotic Door
slate_work:broadcaster_loci.description: Due to the Iotic Door's odd nature of being read from anywhere, it requires a suitable amount of [Quenched Allay](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/quenching_allays) and parts from an [Akashic Library](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/akashiclib).

slate_work:mute_loci.name: Muffling Slate
slate_work:mute_loci.description:
Thankfully, the Muffling Slate is a cheap and simple craft; taking a scrap of wool, and some slate. 
*Silence is gold for some, or even iron for more; but for my self, silence is diamonds.*

slate_work:crafting_loci.name: Patterned Assembler
slate_work:crafting_loci.description: The Patterned Assembler requires the mind of a villager well adapted to paging through tomes and texts; it seems like the Librarian is perfect for this.

slate_work:redstone_loci.name: Redstone Agitator
slate_work:redstone_loci.description: Combing a mixture of redstone dust and [amethyst dust](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#items/amethyst), and intertwining it with a slate creates the exact mixture of redstone conductivity I require.

slate_work:sentinel_loci.name: Sentinel Cache
slate_work:sentinel_loci.description: For this amalgamation of agglomerations, it takes an [Ambit Extender](https://stick404.github.io/SlateWork/v/1.0.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/ambit_loci), to generate the ambit modifications, and a Master level Villager of any kind. If the mind was weaker, it would shatter against the already saturated Flayed Block.

slate_work:macro_loci.name: Spell Imprinter
slate_work:macro_loci.description: Despite the horrors this possibly ascertains... this is still an advantageous block to obtain. I believe a Weaponsmith villager would be the best fit. This is due to their adeptness at reworking broken weapons to new, sharper instruments.

slate_work:storage_loci.name: Storage Vessel
slate_work:storage_loci.description: The Storage Vessel requires a mind capable of diving into the depths, and retrieving something based on only a hint. A Fisherman villager is perfect for this.

slate_work:speed_loci.name: Wave Regulator
slate_work:speed_loci.description: Wave Regulators are odd in their construction compared to the rest of my... *Gifted* visions. All they require is a [scrap of Media](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/quenching_allays) with some writhing will still left in it... how it must be in pain-- and some slate to make it compatible with the [Circle](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/spellcircles).

hierophantics:flay_bed.name: Imbuement Bed
hierophantics:flay_bed.description: The unique properties of allays make the [process](https://robotgiggle.github.io/hierophantics/v/1.3.3/1.0/en_us#greatwork/hierophantics) less expensive than usual. However, those same properties also mean that the mind cannot remain permanently interwoven with my own - it will inevitably disspate over time.

hierophantics:flay_bed.name: Imbuement Bed
hierophantics:flay_bed.description: I can then use some [external device](https://hexcasting.hexxy.media/v/0.11.2/1.0/en_us#greatwork/impetus) to perform the extraction itself, transferring the mind into the bed while I simply lay there until the process – the *integration* – is complete.

hierophantics:flay_bed.name: Imbuement Bed
hierophantics:flay_bed.description: The process requires a master-level villager, which can be transferred into either of the two blocks that make up the Imbuement Bed. However, if I am not in the bed at the moment the spell is cast, the mind will be wasted.

hierophantics:flay_bed.name: Imbuement Bed
hierophantics:flay_bed.description: The process is nearly identical to embedding a mind into myself. The subject must lie in the Imbuement Bed (a [certain spell](https://robotgiggle.github.io/hierophantics/v/1.3.3/1.0/en_us#patterns/spells/villager_sleep) may be helpful) and a new mind must be woven in - though the source here can be of any level.

hierophantics:edified_workstation.name: Edified Workstation
hierophantics:edified_workstation.description: I've noticed that quenched allays tend to morph in response to stray thoughts. This is mostly a nuisance, but here it is critical - the surface of the workstation can adapt itself to whatever the Quiltmind currently needs.

oneironaut:extradimensional_border.name: Transdimensional Anchor
oneironaut:extradimensional_border.description: While I can simply rely on my sentinel when using it in a spell circle, I have also devised an apparatus that allows a portion of the circle's ambit to extend into the target dimension.

hexcassettes:cassette.name: Cassette
hexcassettes:cassette.description: After crafting it by plating a music disc with a hefty amount of charged amethyst to facilitate the assimilation, I can *consume* it to add it to my mind's collection. I can only have six cassettes at a time and any more eaten will simply be wasted.

ephemera:relay_tp_detector.name: Network Gateway Probe
ephemera:relay_tp_detector.description: Outputs a brief redstone signal when an adjacent relay is used as the output for a casting of Network Gateway.

ephemera:relay_index.name: Network Routing Index
ephemera:relay_index.description: When rclicked with a focus in the main hand, attempts to store its iota in the block. When the focus is in the offhand, writes the stored iota to the focus.

hexal:mediafied_storage.name: Mote Nexus
hexal:mediafied_storage.description: The Mote Nexus is built from the mind of a cartographer endlessly mapping the contents of the Shulker Box that it has been flayed into.
